# Cribl Documentation

Cribl is a suite of observability products that help organizations collect, process, route, and analyze their data more efficiently. The Cribl suite includes Stream (observability pipeline), Edge (distributed data collection), Search (query data in place), Lake (open data lake), and Copilot (AI assistant).

## Cribl Stream

- [Manage Worker Groups](http://localhost:4444/stream/worker-groups/index.md): Organize Workers into Workers Groups for easier configuration and management.
- [Manage Workers](http://localhost:4444/stream/manage-workers/index.md): How to manage and filter Stream Worker Nodes

- [Manage Config Bundles](http://localhost:4444/stream/config-bundle-management/index.md): Cribl Stream uses config bundles, compressed archives containing configuration files and data essential for Worker operation.
- [Deploy Stream Configurations](http://localhost:4444/stream/deploying-configurations/index.md): Cribl Stream configurations are deployed after the bundle containing them is saved and committed.
- [Persistent Socket Connections](http://localhost:4444/stream/persisting-socket-connections/index.md): Distributed deployments use Unix domain sockets for inter-process communication (IPC) between a Leader Node's distributed processes and services.
- [Splunk App Deployment](http://localhost:4444/stream/deploy-splunkapp/index.md): Getting started with Cribl App for Splunk
- [Bootstrap Workers from Leader](http://localhost:4444/stream/deploy-workers/index.md): Boot fully provisioned Workers Cribl Stream Workers can completely provision themselves, directly from the Leader, upon initial boot.

- [Kubernetes/Helm Deployment](http://localhost:4444/stream/deploy-kubernetes-leader/index.md): Boot fully provisioned Leader and Worker Nodes via Helm Cribl's leader and workergroup Helm charts provide a fast way to deploy a distributed Cribl Stream environment to a Kubernetes cluster.

- [Using Datagens](http://localhost:4444/stream/datagens/index.md): Data generators for testing and troubleshooting
- [Manage Metrics and High Cardinality](http://localhost:4444/stream/manage-metrics/index.md): Strategies for handling high-cardinality metrics and improving data efficiency
- [Data Onboarding](http://localhost:4444/stream/data-onboarding/index.md): Bringing data into Cribl Stream
- [Enrich Data Using Lookups](http://localhost:4444/stream/using-lookups/index.md): Learn practical strategies for using lookups to enrich data
- [About Lookups](http://localhost:4444/stream/lookups-about/index.md): Learn practical strategies for using lookups to enrich data
- [Configure Lookups](http://localhost:4444/stream/lookups-configure/index.md): Learn the key tasks for uploading, configuring, and using lookup files
- [Lookup Geographic Data from IP Addresses](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-lookups-ip-addresses/index.md): In many observability and security use cases, raw event data includes an IP address, but not much context about where that IP originated from.
- [Lookups as Filters for Masks](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-lookups-filters/index.md): You can make your data architecture more maintainable by using Lookups to route and transform events within Cribl Stream.
- [Lookups and Regex Magic](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-lookups-regex/index.md): Regular expressions are not just for field extractions – they can also be used inside lookup tables, and in Functions, to replace and manipulate values within fields.
- [Data Sampling](http://localhost:4444/stream/data-sampling/index.md): Data sampling lets you analyze and troubleshoot data and plan transformations you need to perform on a selected, representative sample of real-life data.
- [Ingest-Time Sampling](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-sampling/index.md): Let's say that you wanted to analyze and troubleshoot with highly verbose/voluminous data – for example, CDN logs, ELB Access Logs, or VPC Flows – but you were concerned about storage requirements ...
- [Sample Logs](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-sample-logs/index.md): Collecting samples of the event data you plan to work with in Cribl Stream can make your Cribl Stream onboarding experience even quicker and more efficient than if you don't.
- [Access Logs: Apache, ELB, CDN, S3, Etc.](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-access-logs/index.md): Access logs are extremely common.
- [Firewall Logs: VPC Flow Logs, Cisco ASA, Etc.](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-firewall-logs/index.md): Firewall logs are another source of important operational (and security) data.
- [Transforming Data](http://localhost:4444/stream/transforming-data/index.md): Cribl Stream offers multiple ways of transforming, enriching, reducing, and redacting data.
- [Build Custom Logic to Route and Process Your Data](http://localhost:4444/stream/filter-and-transform-data/index.md): How to use JavaScript Expressions to filter, route, and transform data
- [Code Function Examples](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-code-function/index.md): The Code Function is a powerful way to transform events without needing to write a custom function.
- [Ingest-Time Fields](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-ingest-time-fields/index.md): To add new fields to any event, we use the out-of-the-box Eval Function.
- [Masking and Obfuscation](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-masking-and-obfuscation/index.md): To mask patterns in real time, we use the out-of-the-box Mask Function.
- [Encryption of Data in Motion](http://localhost:4444/stream/securing-data-encryption/index.md): Encrypt fields or patterns within events
- [Reducing Windows XML Events](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-win-xml/index.md): Here, we demonstrate how to use just a few Cribl Stream Functions to parse WindowsXML events and reduce their volume by 34–70%, dramatically reducing your downstream infrastructure requirements.
- [Regex Filtering](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-regex-filtering/index.md): To filter events in real time (data in motion), we use the out-of-the-box Regex Filter Function.
- [Functions](http://localhost:4444/stream/functions/index.md): All about Cribl Functions
- [Aggregations](http://localhost:4444/stream/aggregations-function/index.md): Aggregate events in real time
- [Aggregate Metrics](http://localhost:4444/stream/aggregate-metrics-function/index.md): Aggregate metrics and metric events in real time
- [Auto Timestamp](http://localhost:4444/stream/auto-timestamp-function/index.md): Extract timestamps
- [CEF Serializer](http://localhost:4444/stream/cef-serializer-function/index.md): Serialize events to CEF format for a SIEM
- [Chain](http://localhost:4444/stream/chain-function/index.md): Chain data processing from one Pipeline or Pack to another
- [Clone](http://localhost:4444/stream/clone-function/index.md): Duplicate events in the same Pipeline, optionally adding fields
- [Code](http://localhost:4444/stream/code-function/index.md): Encapsulate your own JavaScript code in a Function
- [Comment](http://localhost:4444/stream/comment-function/index.md): Add a text comment within a Pipeline's UI
- [DNS Lookup](http://localhost:4444/stream/dns-lookup-function/index.md): Perform reverse DNS lookups, or DNS lookups based on host name
- [Drop](http://localhost:4444/stream/drop-function/index.md): Drop events
- [Drop Dimensions](http://localhost:4444/stream/drop-dimensions-function/index.md): Drop dimensions from metrics and metric events
- [Dynamic Sampling](http://localhost:4444/stream/dynamic-sampling-function/index.md): Sample events (e.g, high-volume, low-value data)
- [Eval](http://localhost:4444/stream/eval-function/index.md): Add or remove event fields
- [Event Breaker](http://localhost:4444/stream/event-breaker-function/index.md): Break events within a Pipeline
- [Flatten](http://localhost:4444/stream/flatten-function/index.md): Flatten nested structures (e.g., nested JSON)
- [Fold Keys](http://localhost:4444/stream/fold-keys-function/index.md): Convert key names with separators into nested fields
- [GeoIP](http://localhost:4444/stream/geoip-function/index.md): Add GeoIP information to events
- [Grok](http://localhost:4444/stream/grok-function/index.md): Extract structured fields from unstructured log data, using modular regex patterns
- [Guard](http://localhost:4444/stream/guard-function/index.md): Learn how to add the Cribl Guard Function to your Pipelines.
- [JSON Unroll](http://localhost:4444/stream/json-unroll-function/index.md): Convert JSON arrays into their own events
- [Lookup](http://localhost:4444/stream/lookup-function/index.md): Use lookup tables to transform events
- [Mask](http://localhost:4444/stream/mask-function/index.md): Remove sensitive data from events
- [Numerify](http://localhost:4444/stream/numerify-function/index.md): Extract numeric values from event fields
- [OTLP Logs](http://localhost:4444/stream/otlp-logs-function/index.md): Format logs to OTLP
- [OTLP Metrics](http://localhost:4444/stream/otlp-metrics-function/index.md): Format metrics to OTLP
- [OTLP Traces](http://localhost:4444/stream/otlp-traces-function/index.md): Format traces to OTLP
- [Parser](http://localhost:4444/stream/parser-function/index.md): Extract fields
- [Publish Metrics](http://localhost:4444/stream/publish-metrics-function/index.md): Convert events to metrics format
- [Redis](http://localhost:4444/stream/redis-function/index.md): Use a Redis store to accelerate lookups
- [Regex Extract](http://localhost:4444/stream/regex-extract-function/index.md): Extract fields using regex
- [Regex Filter](http://localhost:4444/stream/regex-filter-function/index.md): Drop events using regex
- [Rename](http://localhost:4444/stream/rename-function/index.md): Change or reformat field names individually or in bulk
- [Rollup Metrics](http://localhost:4444/stream/rollup-metrics-function/index.md): Merge/roll up frequently generated metrics into more manageable time windows
- [Sampling](http://localhost:4444/stream/sampling-function/index.md): Sample events (e.g, high-volume, low-value data)
- [Serialize](http://localhost:4444/stream/serialize-function/index.md): Serialize/change format (e.g., convert JSON to CSV)
- [SNMP Trap Serialize](http://localhost:4444/stream/snmp-trap-serialize-function/index.md): Serializes compliant events into SNMP traps
- [Suppress](http://localhost:4444/stream/suppress-function/index.md): Suppress events (e.g, duplicates, etc.)
- [Tee](http://localhost:4444/stream/tee-function/index.md): Send events out to a command or a local file from any point in a Pipeline
- [Unroll](http://localhost:4444/stream/unroll-function/index.md): Break/unroll an array into individual events
- [XML Unroll](http://localhost:4444/stream/xml-unroll-function/index.md): Convert an XML event's set of elements into individual events
- [Prometheus Publisher (deprecated)](http://localhost:4444/stream/prometheus-publisher-function/index.md): Convert events to metrics format
- [Reverse DNS (deprecated)](http://localhost:4444/stream/reverse-dns-function/index.md): Resolve hostname from IP address
- [Trim Timestamp (deprecated)](http://localhost:4444/stream/trim-timestamp-function/index.md): Remove timestamps patterns from events, and optionally store them in fields
- [Integrations](http://localhost:4444/stream/integrations/index.md): Sources and Destinations provide data flow between Cribl and various systems
- [Sources](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources/index.md): Data Sources overview
- [Collector Sources](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors/index.md): Sources that ingest data periodically or ad hoc
- [Azure Blob Storage Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-azure-blob/index.md): Collect and replay data from Azure Blob Storage objects
- [Cribl Lake Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-cribl-lake/index.md): Replay data from Cribl Lake
- [Database Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-database/index.md): Configuring event collection from data stored in DBMSs
- [Filesystem/NFS Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-filesystem/index.md): Collect and replay data from local or remote filesystem locations
- [Google Cloud Storage Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-google-cloud-storage/index.md): Collect and replay data from Google Cloud Storage buckets
- [Health Check Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-health-check/index.md): Use a Health Check Collector to monitor the availability of your systems
- [REST / API Endpoint Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-rest/index.md): Collect and replay data via REST API calls
- [S3 Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-s3/index.md): Collect and replay data from Amazon S3 buckets or S3-compatible stores
- [Script Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-script/index.md): Collect and replay data via custom scripts
- [Splunk Search Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-splunk-search/index.md): Collect and replay data from Splunk queries
- [Manage Collector State in Database and REST API Collectors](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-manage-state/index.md): Manage Collector State in Database and REST API Collectors
- [Scheduling and Running](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-schedule-run/index.md): Schedule a Collector to run on a recurring interval
- [Job Limits](http://localhost:4444/stream/collectors-job-limits/index.md): Configure global limits to optimize execution of Collectors and scheduled jobs
- [Using Collectors](http://localhost:4444/stream/using-collectors/index.md): Learn how to replay events using collectors gathering data from various senders.
- [Using S3 Storage and Replay](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-replay-s3/index.md): Cribl Stream's Replay options offer organizations fundamentally new ways to manage data, by providing an easy way to selectively ingest, and re‑ingest, data into systems of analysis.
- [Using REST/API Collectors](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-rest/index.md): The REST/API Endpoint Collector is powerful, but complex.
- [Lacework API Collection](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-lacework-api/index.md): Collect data from the Lacework API
- [Microsoft Graph API Collection](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-rest-ms-graph/index.md): The Microsoft Graph API provides access to data in the Microsoft Cloud.
- [ServiceNow API Collection](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-rest-snow/index.md): This topic covers how to configure Cribl Stream REST Collectors to gather data via ServiceNow (SNOW) REST APIs and then enrich the data using Pipelines and the Redis Function.
- [Creating a Custom Collector](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-rest-create-collector/index.md): Creating a custom Collector
- [Use REST Packs to Get Started With Okta Data REST Collection](http://localhost:4444/stream/pack-usecase-okta-rest-collector/index.md): Install and configure the Okta REST Collector Pack from the Packs Dispensary
- [Amazon](http://localhost:4444/stream/amazon-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Amazon services.
- [Amazon Data Firehose Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-kinesis-firehose/index.md): Receive Amazon Data Firehose streams via HTTP endpoint
- [Amazon Kinesis Data Streams Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-kinesis-streams/index.md): Receive data records from Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
- [Amazon S3 Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-s3/index.md): Receive data from Amazon S3 buckets
- [Amazon Security Lake Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-security-lake/index.md): Configuring Amazon Security Lake Source
- [Amazon SQS Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-sqs/index.md): Receive events from Amazon Simple Queuing Service
- [Azure](http://localhost:4444/stream/azure-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Azure services.
- [Azure Blob Storage Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-azure-blob/index.md): Receive data from Azure Blob Storage buckets
- [Azure Event Hubs Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-azure-event-hubs/index.md): Receive data records from Azure Event Hubs
- [Google Cloud](http://localhost:4444/stream/google-cloud-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Google Cloud services.
- [Google Cloud Pub/Sub Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-google_pubsub/index.md): Receive data records from Google Cloud Pub/Sub
- [Kafka](http://localhost:4444/stream/kafka-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Kafka services.
- [Kafka Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-kafka/index.md): Receive data records from a Kafka cluster
- [Confluent Cloud Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-confluent/index.md): Receive Kafka topics from Confluent Cloud
- [Amazon MSK Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-msk/index.md): Receive data records from an Amazon MSK cluster
- [Office 365](http://localhost:4444/stream/office-365-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Office 365 services.
- [Office 365 Activity Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-office-365-activity/index.md): Receive data from the Office 365 Management Activity API
- [Office 365 Message Trace Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-office365-msg-trace/index.md): Receive Office 365 Message Trace data
- [Office 365 Services Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-office-365-services/index.md): Receive data from the Microsoft Graph service communications API
- [Prometheus](http://localhost:4444/stream/prometheus-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Prometheus services.
- [Prometheus Scraper Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-prometheus/index.md): Receive batched data from Prometheus targets
- [Prometheus Remote Write Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-prometheus-remote-write/index.md): Receive metric data from Prometheus via the remote write protocol
- [Grafana Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-grafana/index.md): Receive metric and log data from Grafana Agent via Prometheus remote write
- [Loki Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-loki/index.md): Receive log data from Grafana Loki
- [Splunk](http://localhost:4444/stream/splunk-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Splunk services.
- [Splunk HEC Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-splunk-hec/index.md): Receive data over HTTP/S using the Splunk HEC
- [Splunk Search Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-splunk-search/index.md): Ingest data by executing Splunk search queries
- [Splunk TCP Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-splunk/index.md): Receive Splunk data from Universal or Heavy Forwarders
- [Internal](http://localhost:4444/stream/internal-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from internal senders.
- [Cribl Internal Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-cribl-internal/index.md): Capture Cribl Stream's internal logs and metrics and send them through Routes and Pipelines
- [Cribl HTTP Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-cribl-http/index.md): Receive data from peer Nodes managed by the same Leader when raw TCP traffic is not an option
- [Cribl TCP Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-cribl-tcp/index.md): Send data between Worker Nodes/Edge Nodes connected to the same Leader
- [System](http://localhost:4444/stream/system-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from internal senders.
- [Datagen Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-datagens/index.md): Generate data from datagen files
- [Exec Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-exec/index.md): Execute a command periodically, and collect its stdout output
- [File Monitor Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-file-monitor/index.md): Collect log files and generate events from the file content
- [Journal Files Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-journal-files/index.md): Collects data from systemd's journald service
- [System Metrics Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-system-metrics/index.md): Collect metrics from a host, and populate dashboards
- [System State Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-system-state/index.md): Collects the system's current state on a configurable schedule, relaying corresponding events to downstream systems.
- [AppScope Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-appscope/index.md): Receive data from the AppScope open-source instrumentation utility
- [Cloudflare Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-cloudflare-hec/index.md): Receive data from Cloudflare Logpush
- [CrowdStrike FDR Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-crowdstrike/index.md): Receive data from the CrowdStrike FDR platform
- [Datadog Agent Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-datadog-agent/index.md): Receive data from Datadog Agent
- [Elasticsearch API Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-elastic/index.md): Receive data over HTTP/S using the Elasticsearch Bulk API
- [HTTP/S (Bulk API) Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-https/index.md): Receive data over HTTP/S via the Cribl Bulk API, Splunk HEC, or Elastic Bulk API
- [Raw HTTP/S Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-raw-http/index.md): Receive raw HTTP data
- [Metrics Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-metrics/index.md): Receive metrics in the StatsD, StatsD Extended, and Graphite wire formats/protocols
- [Model Driven Telemetry Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-model-driven-telemetry/index.md): Receive network device metrics and events via Model Driven Telemetry
- [NetFlow & IPFIX Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-netflow/index.md): Receive NetFlow & IPFIX data over UDP
- [OpenTelemetry (OTel) Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-otel/index.md): Receive trace and metric events from OTLP-compliant senders
- [SNMP Trap Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-snmp-traps/index.md): Receive data from SNMP Traps
- [Syslog Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-syslog/index.md): Receive syslog data
- [TCP JSON Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-tcp-json/index.md): Receive newline-delimited JSON data over TCP
- [TCP (Raw) Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-tcp-raw/index.md): Receive data over TCP
- [UDP (Raw) Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-raw-udp/index.md): Receive data over UDP
- [Windows Event Forwarder Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-wef/index.md): Receive events from Windows platforms
- [Client Certificate Authentication for Windows Event Forwarder](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-wef-client/index.md): Client certificate authentication setup for the Windows Event Forwarder Source
- [Kerberos Authentication for Windows Event Forwarder](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-wef-kerberos/index.md): Kerberos authentication setup for the Windows Event Forwarder Source

- [Wiz API Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-wiz/index.md): Configuring collection from Wiz
- [Wiz Webhook](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-wiz-webhook/index.md): Configuring collection from Wiz
- [Zscaler Cloud NSS Source](http://localhost:4444/stream/sources-zscaler-hec/index.md): Receive log data over HTTP/S from Zscaler Cloud NSS

- [DevNull Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-devnull/index.md): Drop events when testing Pipelines and Routes

- [Cloudflare R2 Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-cloudflare-r2/index.md): Send data to Cloudflare R2 object storage using an S3-compatible API

- [Datadog Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-datadog/index.md): Send log and metric events to Datadog
- [Dynatrace HTTP Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-dynatrace-http/index.md): Send logs to Dynatrace
- [Dynatrace OTLP](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-dynatrace-otlp/index.md): Send telemetry data to Dynatrace using OTLP
- [Exabeam Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-exabeam/index.md): Send data to Exabeam SIEM
- [Fabric Real-Time Intelligence](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-fabric-real-time-intelligence/index.md): Send data to Microsoft Fabric Eventstreams
- [Filesystem/NFS Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-fs/index.md): Output files to a local file system or NFS
- [Honeycomb Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-honeycomb/index.md): Send events to a Honeycomb dataset
- [InfluxDB Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-influxdb/index.md): Send data to InfluxDB and InfluxDB Cloud
- [MinIO Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-minio/index.md): Send objects to MinIO buckets
- [NetFlow Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-netflow/index.md): Send data to NetFlow
- [OpenTelemetry (OTel) Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-otel/index.md): Send events to OTLP-compliant targets
- [SentinelOne AI SIEM Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-sentinel-one-ai-siem/index.md): Stream data to SentinelOne’s AI SIEM platform
- [SentinelOne DataSet Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-dataset/index.md): Send log events to SentinelOne DataSet
- [ServiceNow Cloud Observability](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-servicenow/index.md): Send events to ServiceNow Cloud Observability
- [SignalFx Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-signalfx/index.md): Send events to SignalFx
- [SNMP Trap Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-snmp-traps/index.md): Forward SNMP Traps out
- [Sumo Logic Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-sumo-logic/index.md): Send log and metric events to Sumo Logic over HTTP
- [Syslog Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-syslog/index.md): Send out data over syslog via TCP or UDP
- [TCP JSON Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-tcp-json/index.md): Send data over TCP in JSON format
- [Wavefront Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-wavefront/index.md): Send events to Wavefront analytics
- [Webhook Destination](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-webhook/index.md): Send log and metric events to webhooks and generic HTTP endpoints
- [Manage Backpressure](http://localhost:4444/stream/manage-backpressure/index.md): Learn how to use Cribl to manage backpressure and prevent data loss
- [About Persistent Queues](http://localhost:4444/stream/persistent-queues/index.md): Learn how persistent queues prevent data loss
- [Optimize Source Persistent Queues](http://localhost:4444/stream/persistent-queues-sources/index.md): This page explains choices to consider when enabling Source persistent queues in your system.
- [Optimize Destination Persistent Queues](http://localhost:4444/stream/persistent-queues-destinations/index.md): This page explains choices to consider when enabling Destination persistent queues in your system
- [About Destination Backpressure Triggers](http://localhost:4444/stream/destinations-backpressure-triggers/index.md): This page documents backpressure triggers and behavior in Cribl Stream and Cribl Edge Destinations.
- [About Load Balancing](http://localhost:4444/stream/load-balancing/index.md): Details about configuring load balancing on Cribl Destinations
- [Configure Host Metadata](http://localhost:4444/stream/host-metadata/index.md): Host metadata can be collected for enabled Sources per Worker Node.
- [Cribl Edge to Cribl Stream](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-edge-stream/index.md): Sending data from Cribl Edge to Cribl Stream
- [Transfer Data Between Workspaces or Environments](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-transfer-data/index.md): Transfer data between Cribl.Cloud Workspaces or on-prem Cribl environments without paying twice.
- [Integrating with Other Services](http://localhost:4444/stream/integrating-other/index.md): The following topics provide detailed guides and better practice for integrating with different external services.
- [Amazon](http://localhost:4444/stream/amazon-integrating/index.md): The following topics provide detailed guides and better practice for integrating with Amazon services.
- [AWS Cross-Account Data Collection](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-aws-x-account/index.md): Collecting and writing data across multiple AWS accounts
- [Amazon S3 Better Practices](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-s3-better-practices/index.md): Read, write, and replay with S3
- [Amazon Security Lake Integration](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-security-lake/index.md): Integrate Cribl Stream's Amazon Security Lake Destination with its Namesake Service
- [Collecting Logs from Amazon ECS Containers](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-ecs-fargate/index.md): Collect logs from Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS)
- [Azure](http://localhost:4444/stream/azure-integrating/index.md): The following topics provide detailed guides and better practice for integrating with Azure services.
- [Prepare the Azure Workspace for Cribl Integrations](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-azure-workspace/index.md): Preparing the Azure Workspace for Cribl Integrations
- [Azure Event Hubs Integrations](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-azure-event-hubs/index.md): Ingest data from an Azure Event Hub
- [Microsoft Sentinel SIEM Integration {#preamble}](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-azure-sentinel/index.md): Set up Cribl to send data to the Microsoft Sentinel SIEM
- [Splunk](http://localhost:4444/stream/splunk-integrating/index.md): The following topics provide detailed guides and better practice for integrating with Splunk services.
- [Splunk Cloud Platform and BYOL Integrations](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-splunk-cloud-integrations/index.md): Integrating with the Splunk Cloud Platform by using the Splunk HTTP Event Collector
- [Switch Cribl Stream Destinations from S2S to Splunk HEC](http://localhost:4444/stream/s2s-to-hec/index.md): How to switch your data collection from Splunk to Splunk (S2S) to HTTP Event Collector (HEC)
- [Splunk to Elasticsearch](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-splunk-elasticsearch/index.md): Routing data from Splunk to Elasticsearch services
- [Splunk to Exabeam](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-exabeam/index.md): Exporting parsed data to Exabeam
- [Splunk Stream to Cribl Stream](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-splunk-stream/index.md): Sending data from Splunk Stream packages to Cribl Stream
- [Decryption of Data in Splunk](http://localhost:4444/stream/securing-data-decryption/index.md): Decrypting data with Splunk
- [Stream-to-Splunk Encryption](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-encrypting-data/index.md): Encrypting and decrypting data moving from Cribl Stream to Splunk
- [Syslog](http://localhost:4444/stream/syslog-integrating/index.md): The following topics provide detailed guides and better practice for integrating with Syslog services.
- [Syslog Best Practices](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-syslog/index.md): Best practices for processing syslog events
- [Syslog TLS to Cribl.Cloud (Palo Alto Example)](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-syslog-cloud/index.md): Palo Alto Syslog Forwarding to Cribl.Cloud
- [Configure Upstream Logging Agents](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-logging-agents/index.md): Connect common logging agents to Cribl Stream
- [BigPanda/Webhook Integration](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-webhook-bigpanda/index.md): Configure Cribl Stream to send Webhook notifications to the BigPanda IT Ops platform
- [Gigamon to Cribl Stream](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-gigamon-stream/index.md): Sending data from Gigamon to Cribl Stream
- [System Metrics to Grafana](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-metrics-grafana/index.md): Sending data from System Metrics to Grafana
- [Kafka Authentication with Kerberos](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-kafka-kerberos/index.md): This topic describes a procedure for configuring Kafka Sources and Destinations for Kerberos authentication.
- [Moogsoft/Webhook Integration](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-moogsoft/index.md): Configure Cribl Stream to send Webhook notifications to Moogsoft
- [Nightfall Integration](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-nightfall/index.md): Integrating Cribl Stream with Nightfall to detect and redact sensitive information
- [Managing QRadar Licenses](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-qradar/index.md): Reduce QRadar costs with fine-grained control over events sent
- [Slack/Webhook Integration](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-webhook-slack/index.md): This page describes how to integrate Cribl Stream with Slack via the Cribl Stream Webhook Destination.
- [Zscaler NSS Virtual Machine](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-zscaler-logs/index.md): Reduce the size of ZScaler logs with Cribl Stream
- [Tanium to Cribl Stream](http://localhost:4444/stream/usecase-tanium-stream/index.md): Sending data from Tanium to Cribl Stream
- [Knowledge Libraries](http://localhost:4444/stream/knowledge-library/index.md): Knowledge objects overview
- [Lookups Library](http://localhost:4444/stream/lookups-library/index.md): Use these data tables to enrich events processed by the Lookup Function
- [Event Breakers](http://localhost:4444/stream/event-breakers/index.md): Break incoming streams of data into discrete events
- [Parsers Library](http://localhost:4444/stream/parsers-library/index.md): Library of parsers for use within Parser Functions
- [Variables Library](http://localhost:4444/stream/global-variables-library/index.md): Use and reuse these JavaScript expressions in Functions in any Pipeline
- [Regex Library](http://localhost:4444/stream/regex-library/index.md): A set of pre-built common regex patterns
- [Grok Patterns Library](http://localhost:4444/stream/grok-patterns-library/index.md): Library of patterns for use within Grok Functions
- [Schemas Library](http://localhost:4444/stream/schema-library/index.md): Schemas for validating inbound JSON events and writing out Parquet data
- [Parquet Schemas](http://localhost:4444/stream/parquet-schemas/index.md): Schemas for writing out Parquet data
- [Database Connections](http://localhost:4444/stream/database-connections/index.md): Configure DBMS resources from which the Database Collector can retrieve events
- [HMAC Functions](http://localhost:4444/stream/hmac-functions/index.md): Defines custom HMAC algorithm parameters for vendor-specific implementations
- [AppScope Configs](http://localhost:4444/stream/appscope-configs/index.md): AppScope config library
- [Reference](http://localhost:4444/stream/reference/index.md): A reference for Cribl Stream, including: - Cribl Expressions - CLI - Environment variables - Config files For reference documentation for the Cribl API, see the API Reference.
- [Cribl Expressions](http://localhost:4444/stream/cribl-reference/index.md): Native Cribl Stream methods, found under C.*
- [C.Crypto](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-crypto/index.md): Native Cribl methods for encryption and decryption
- [C.Decode and C.Encode](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-encode-decode/index.md): Native Cribl methods for encoding and decoding
- [C.Lookup](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-lookup/index.md): Native Cribl methods for lookups
- [C.Mask](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-mask/index.md): Native Cribl methods for masking
- [C.Net](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-net/index.md): Native Cribl methods for encryption and decryption
- [C.Text](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-text/index.md): Native Cribl methods for text manipulation
- [C.Time](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-time/index.md): Native Cribl methods for time
- [Other expressions](http://localhost:4444/stream/expressions-other/index.md): Miscellaneous native Cribl methods
- [String](http://localhost:4444/stream/string-reference/index.md): How to use JavaScript strings in Cribl expressions
- [Date](http://localhost:4444/stream/date-reference/index.md): How to use Cribl Expressions as inputs to Cribl Functions
- [Math](http://localhost:4444/stream/math-reference/index.md): The Math JavaScript object, and its methods
- [Number](http://localhost:4444/stream/number-reference/index.md): The Number JavaScript object, and its methods
- [CLI Reference](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-reference/index.md): Command line interface basics
- [auth](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-auth/index.md): Command to log into or out of the product
- [boot-start](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-boot-start/index.md): Command to enable or disable product boot-start
- [cloud-workspace](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-cloud-workspace/index.md): Command to update a Leader with new config that allows it to connect to the Cribl.Cloud Leader and send it usage metrics
- [decrypt](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-decrypt/index.md): Command to decrypt data with a secret key
- [diag](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-diag/index.md): Command to manage diagnostic bundles
- [encrypt](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-encrypt/index.md): Command to encrypt data with a secret key
- [git](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-git/index.md): Command to manage Worker Group or Fleet configuration
- [help](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-help/index.md): Displays a list of commands and their help
- [keys](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-keys/index.md): Command to manage encryption keys
- [limits](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-limits/index.md): Command to control the availability of Cribl features
- [mode-master](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-mode-master/index.md): Command to configure an instance as a Leader
- [mode-single](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-mode-single/index.md): Command to configure an instance as a Single-instance deployment
- [mode-edge](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-mode-edge/index.md): Command to configure Cribl Edge as a Single-instance deployment
- [mode-worker](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-mode-worker/index.md): Command to configure Cribl Stream as a Worker instance
- [mode-managed-edge](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-mode-managed-edge/index.md): Command to configure Cribl Edge as an Edge Node
- [mode-outpost](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-mode-outpost/index.md): Command to configure an instance as an Outpost Node
- [nc](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-nc/index.md): Command to listen a port for traffic and output stats and data
- [node](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-node/index.md): Command to execute a JavaScript file
- [pack](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-pack/index.md): Command to mange Cribl packs
- [parquet](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-parquet/index.md): Command to view a Parquet file, its metadata, or its schema
- [pipe](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-pipe/index.md): Command to feed stdin to a Pipeline
- [pq](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-pq/index.md): Command for persistent queue performance benchmarking
- [reload](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-reload/index.md): Command to reload the product
- [restart](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-restart/index.md): Command to restart the product
- [scope](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-scope/index.md): Scope a Linux Command via AppScope
- [start](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-start/index.md): Command to start the product
- [status](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-status/index.md): Command to display the product status
- [stop](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-stop/index.md): Command to stop the product
- [vars](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-vars/index.md): Command to manage global variables
- [version](http://localhost:4444/stream/cli-version/index.md): Command to display product version
- [Environment Variables](http://localhost:4444/stream/environment-variables/index.md): Environment variables available for configuring Cribl Stream
- [Configuration Files](http://localhost:4444/stream/configuration-files/index.md): How configuration paths and files are laid out on the filesystem
- [breakers.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/breakersyml/index.md): Config file where Cribl's default Event Breaker Library is stored
- [certificates.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/certificatesyml/index.md): Config file that lists configured certificates and their parameters
- [cribl.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/criblyml/index.md): Config file that contains system properties, and API settings
- [groups.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/groupsyml/index.md): Config file that lists groups and their configuration versions
- [inputs.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/inputsyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for configuring inputs to Cribl
- [instance.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/instanceyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for Leader, Worker, and Single instances
- [iometrics.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/iometricsyml/index.md): Config file that defines the metrics levels for individual Sources and Destinations
- [jobs.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/jobsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for configured Collectors
- [job-limits.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/job-limitsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for Collector jobs
- [leader.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/leaderyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for secondary Leader when failover is configured
- [limits.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/limitsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for system tasks
- [logger.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/loggeryml/index.md): Config file that maintains logging levels and redactions, per channel
- [mappings.yml and fleet-mappings.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/mappingsyml/index.md): Config file that lists mapping ruleset configurations
- [messages.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/messagesyml/index.md): Config file that stores messages displayed in the UI's Messages fly-out
- [notifications.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/notificationsyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for configuring Notifications.
- [outpost.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/outpostyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for a Cribl Outpost instance
- [outputs.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/outputsyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for Cribl Stream Destinations
- [parsers.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/parsersyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for Cribl Destinations
- [persistent-queue.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/persistent-queueyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for configuring persistent queues.
- [regexes.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/regexesyml/index.md): Config file that lists regexes, including (by default) the Cribl Regex Library
- [samples.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/samplesyml/index.md): Config file that contains metadata about stored sample data files
- [schemas.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/schemasyml/index.md): Config file that describes schemas in the Knowledge > Schema Library
- [scripts.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/scriptsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for scripts
- [service.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/serviceyml/index.md): service.yml maintains configuration for Cribl Stream and Cribl Edge service processes
- [vars.yml](http://localhost:4444/stream/varsyml/index.md): Config file that contains global variables
- [Troubleshooting](http://localhost:4444/stream/troubleshooting/index.md): Overview of troubleshooting resources for Cribl Stream
- [Known Issues](http://localhost:4444/stream/known-issues/index.md): Issues affecting Cribl Stream, with workarounds and fix versions
- [Diagnosing Issues](http://localhost:4444/stream/diagnosing/index.md): Diagnosing issues and exporting a diagnostic bundle
- [Common Errors and Warnings](http://localhost:4444/stream/common-errors/index.md): Common errors and warnings in Cribl Stream's internal logs and/or UI
- [Git Push Errors](http://localhost:4444/stream/git-push-errors/index.md): This page anticipates common errors you might see in Cribl Stream's UI, or in the `git` CLI, when pushing a commit.
- [Git Remote Repos & Trusted CAs](http://localhost:4444/stream/git-certificate-errors/index.md): If you are using an internal Git server, a self-signed certificate might prevent Cribl Stream from successfully pushing commits to the origin.
- [Sample Logs for Login Scenarios](http://localhost:4444/stream/sample-login-logs/index.md): Sample Login Event Logs
- [CrowdStream](http://localhost:4444/stream/deploy-crowdstream/index.md): Set up Cribl.Cloud's integration with CrowdStrike Falcon LogScale
- [Third-Party Credits](http://localhost:4444/stream/third-party-current-list/index.md)

## Cribl Edge

- [About Cribl Edge](http://localhost:4444/edge/about/index.md): Basic overview of Edge

- [Log in to Cribl](http://localhost:4444/edge/login/index.md)
- [QuickConnect](http://localhost:4444/edge/quickconnect/index.md): Use QuickConnect to sent data from Sources to Destinations with drag-and-drop

- [Design Fleet Hierarchy](http://localhost:4444/edge/fleets-design/index.md): Organize your Fleet and Subfleet hierarchy according to better practices
- [Fleet Inheritance](http://localhost:4444/edge/fleet-inheritance/index.md): Simplify Fleet management with configuration inheritance
- [Configure Fleet Settings](http://localhost:4444/edge/fleet-settings/index.md): Configure teleporting, throughput throttling, logging, and security at the Edge Fleet level
- [Create and Manage Fleets and Subfleets](http://localhost:4444/edge/fleets-create-manage/index.md): Learn how to create and manage Fleets and Subfleets
- [Configure Fleets and Deploy Changes](http://localhost:4444/edge/fleets-configuration/index.md): Learn how to configure Fleets, then commit and deploy configurations
- [Recover a Deleted Fleet](http://localhost:4444/edge/fleets-recover/index.md): Recover deleted Cribl Edge Fleets
- [Edge Nodes](http://localhost:4444/edge/edge-nodes/index.md): Communication between Edge Nodes and Leader Nodes
- [Manage Edge Nodes](http://localhost:4444/edge/managing-edge-nodes/index.md): View, monitor, and manage Edge Nodes

- [Filter Edge Nodes](http://localhost:4444/edge/edge-nodes-filter/index.md): Narrow down the Edge Nodes list by filtering
- [Mapping Edge Nodes to Fleets](http://localhost:4444/edge/mapping-edge-nodes/index.md): Use Mapping Rulesets to map Edge Nodes to Fleets

- [Configuring Workspaces](http://localhost:4444/edge/workspaces-configuring/index.md)
- [Administering](http://localhost:4444/edge/administering/index.md): Manage your Cribl Edge deployment
- [FinOps Center](http://localhost:4444/edge/cloud-billing/index.md): The source of truth for your Cribl credit consumption and product usage.
- [Upgrade Cribl Edge](http://localhost:4444/edge/upgrading/index.md): Overview of upgrading a Cribl Edge deployment
- [Upgrade Leader Node](http://localhost:4444/edge/upgrade-leader/index.md): Upgrade the Leader Node of your Distributed deployment of Cribl Edge

- [Securing](http://localhost:4444/edge/securing/index.md)

- [Secure your On-Prem/Hybrid Deployment](http://localhost:4444/edge/securing-onprem/index.md): Secure your On-Prem Deployment

- [Integrations](http://localhost:4444/edge/integrations/index.md): Sources and Destinations provide data flow between Cribl and various systems
- [Sources](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources/index.md): Data Sources overview
- [System](http://localhost:4444/edge/system-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from internal senders.
- [Exec Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-exec/index.md): Execute a command periodically, and collect its stdout output
- [File Monitor Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-file-monitor/index.md): Collect log files and generate events from the file content
- [Journal Files Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-journal-files/index.md): Collects data from systemd's journald service
- [Kubernetes Events Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-kubernetes-events/index.md): Generate events for a Kubernetes cluster
- [Kubernetes Logs Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-kubernetes-logs/index.md): Collects logs from containers on a Kubernetes node.
- [Kubernetes Metrics Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-kubernetes-metrics/index.md): Generate events for Kubernetes clusters, nodes, Pods, and containers.
- [System Metrics Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-system-metrics/index.md): Collect metrics from a host, and populate dashboards
- [System State Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-system-state/index.md): Collects the system's current state on a configurable schedule, relaying corresponding events to downstream systems.
- [Internal](http://localhost:4444/edge/internal-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from internal senders.
- [Cribl HTTP Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-cribl-http/index.md): Receive data from peer Nodes managed by the same Leader when raw TCP traffic is not an option
- [Cribl TCP Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-cribl-tcp/index.md): Send data between Edge Nodes connected to the same Leader
- [Cribl Internal Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-cribl-internal/index.md): Capture Edge internal logs and metrics
- [Datagen Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-datagens/index.md): Generate data from datagen files
- [Amazon](http://localhost:4444/edge/amazon-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Amazon services.
- [Amazon Data Firehose Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-kinesis-firehose/index.md): Receive Amazon Data Firehose streams via Kinesis' HTTP endpoint
- [Prometheus](http://localhost:4444/edge/prometheus-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Prometheus services.
- [Prometheus Edge Scraper Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-edge-prometheus/index.md): Receive batched data from Prometheus targets for Cribl Edge
- [Prometheus Remote Write Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-prometheus-remote-write/index.md): Receive metric data from Prometheus via the remote write protocol
- [Grafana Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-grafana/index.md): Receive metric and log data from Grafana Agent via Prometheus remote write
- [Loki Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-loki/index.md): Receive log data from Grafana Loki
- [Splunk](http://localhost:4444/edge/splunk-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Splunk services.
- [Splunk HEC Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-splunk-hec/index.md): Receive data over HTTP/S using the Splunk HEC
- [Splunk TCP Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-splunk/index.md): Receive Splunk data from Universal or Heavy Forwarders
- [Windows](http://localhost:4444/edge/windows-sources/index.md): You can use the following Sources to receive data from Windows services.
- [Windows Event Forwarder Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-wef/index.md): Receive events from Windows platforms
- [Client Certificate Authentication for Windows Event Forwarder](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-wef-client/index.md): Client certificate authentication setup for the Windows Event Forwarder Source
- [Kerberos Authentication for Windows Event Forwarder](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-wef-kerberos/index.md): Kerberos authentication setup for the Windows Event Forwarder Source
- [Windows Event Logs Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-windows-event-logs/index.md): Read events from the Windows Events API
- [Windows Metrics Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-windows-metrics/index.md): Collect metrics from a Windows host, and populate dashboards
- [AppScope Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-appscope/index.md): Receive data from the AppScope open-source instrumentation utility
- [Cloudflare Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-cloudflare-hec/index.md): Receive data from Cloudflare Logpush
- [Datadog Agent Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-datadog-agent/index.md): Receive data from Datadog Agent
- [Elasticsearch API Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-elastic/index.md): Receive data over HTTP/S using the Elasticsearch Bulk API
- [HTTP/S (Bulk API) Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-https/index.md): Receive data over HTTP/S via the Cribl Bulk API, Splunk HEC, or Elastic Bulk API
- [Raw HTTP/S Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-raw-http/index.md): Receive raw HTTP data
- [Metrics Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-metrics/index.md): Receive metrics in the StatsD, StatsD Extended, and Graphite wire formats/protocols
- [Model Driven Telemetry Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-model-driven-telemetry/index.md): Receive network device metrics and events via Model Driven Telemetry
- [NetFlow & IPFIX Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-netflow/index.md): Receive NetFlow & IPFIX data over UDP
- [OpenTelemetry (OTel) Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-otel/index.md): Receive trace and metric events from OTLP-compliant senders
- [SNMP Trap Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-snmp-traps/index.md): Receive data from SNMP Traps
- [Syslog Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-syslog/index.md): Receive syslog data
- [TCP JSON Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-tcp-json/index.md): Receive newline-delimited JSON data over TCP
- [TCP (Raw) Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-tcp-raw/index.md): Receive data over TCP
- [UDP (Raw) Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-raw-udp/index.md): Receive data over UDP
- [Zscaler Cloud NSS Source](http://localhost:4444/edge/sources-zscaler-hec/index.md): Receive log data over HTTP/S from Zscaler Cloud NSS
- [Destinations](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations/index.md): Destination categories and descriptions
- [Managing Destinations](http://localhost:4444/edge/managing-destinations/index.md): Creating and configuring Destinations
- [Internal](http://localhost:4444/edge/internal-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following internal receivers: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Cribl HTTP | Send data between peer Nodes via HTTP | | Cribl TCP | Send data bet...
- [Cribl HTTP Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-cribl-http/index.md): Send data between peer Nodes via HTTP
- [Cribl TCP Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-cribl-tcp/index.md): Send data between peer Nodes via raw TCP
- [Disk Spool Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-disk-spool/index.md): Spool incoming event data and hold it in a consistent location
- [Default Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-default/index.md): Specify a default output from among your Destinations
- [DevNull Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-devnull/index.md): Drop events when testing Pipelines and Routes
- [Output Router Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-output-router/index.md): Routes data to Destinations based on defined rules
- [Amazon](http://localhost:4444/edge/amazon-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Amazon services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Amazon CloudWatch Logs | Send data to Amazon CloudWatch Logs | | Amazon Kinesis Dat...
- [Amazon CloudWatch Logs Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-cloudwatch-logs/index.md): Send data to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
- [Amazon Kinesis Data Streams Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-kinesis-streams/index.md): Deliver data to a Kinesis Data Stream
- [Amazon S3 Compatible Stores Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-s3/index.md): Send data to Amazon S3 or to an S3-compatible store
- [Amazon SQS Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-sqs/index.md): Send events to Amazon Simple Queuing Service
- [Amazon Security Lake Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-security-lake/index.md): Send OCSF data to Amazon Security Lake in Parquet format
- [Azure](http://localhost:4444/edge/azure-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Azure services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Azure Blob Storage | Deliver data to Azure Blog Storage or Azure Data Lake Storage G...
- [Azure Blob Storage Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-azure-blob/index.md): Deliver data to Azure Blog Storage or Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
- [Azure Data Explorer Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-azure-data-explorer/index.md): Send batched or streaming data to the Azure Data Explorer managed data analytics service
- [Azure Event Hubs Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-azure-event-hubs/index.md): Send data to Azure Event Hubs
- [Azure Monitor Logs Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-azure-monitor-logs/index.md): Send data to Azure Monitor Logs
- [Microsoft Sentinel Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-sentinel/index.md): Send Log and Metric Events to Microsoft Sentinel SIEM
- [Elastic](http://localhost:4444/edge/elastic-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Elastic services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Elasticsearch | Send events to an Elasticsearch cluster using the Bulk API | | Ela...
- [Elasticsearch Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-elastic/index.md): Send events to an Elasticsearch cluster using the Bulk API
- [Elastic Cloud Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-elastic-cloud/index.md): Send events to Elastic Cloud
- [Google Cloud](http://localhost:4444/edge/google-cloud-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Google Cloud services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Google SecOps | Send data to Google Security Operations (SecOps) | | Google C...
- [Google Security Operations (SecOps) Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-google_chronicle/index.md): Send data to Google Security Operations (SecOps)
- [Google Cloud Chronicle API Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-google-chronicle-api/index.md): Send data to Google Cloud Chronicle API
- [Google Cloud Logging Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-google-logging/index.md): Send data to Google Cloud Logging
- [Google Cloud Pub/Sub Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-google_pubsub/index.md): Send data to Google Cloud Pub/Sub
- [Google Cloud Storage Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-google-cloud-storage/index.md): Send data to Google Cloud Storage
- [Kafka](http://localhost:4444/edge/kafka-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Kafka services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Kafka | Send data to a Kafka topic | | Confluent Cloud | Send data to Kafka topics o...
- [Kafka Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-kafka/index.md): Send data to a Kafka topic
- [Confluent Cloud Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-confluent/index.md): Send data to Kafka topics on Confluent Cloud
- [Amazon MSK Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-msk/index.md): Send data to a topic in Amazon MSK
- [Metrics](http://localhost:4444/edge/metrics-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Metrics services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Graphite | Send data to a Graphite Destination | | StatsD | Send data to a StatsD ...

- [New Relic Ingest](http://localhost:4444/edge/new-relic-ingest-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following New Relic Ingest services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | New Relic Events | Send events to New Relic via the New Relic Event API |...
