- [Prometheus](http://localhost:4444/edge/prometheus-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Prometheus services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Prometheus | Send metric events to Prometheus remote write targets | | Grafana ...
- [Prometheus Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-prometheus/index.md): Send metric events to Prometheus remote write targets
- [Grafana Cloud Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-grafana_cloud/index.md): Send data to Loki for logs and Prometheus for metrics
- [Loki Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-loki/index.md): Send log events to Loki
- [Splunk](http://localhost:4444/edge/splunk-destinations/index.md): You can send data from Cribl Edge to the following Splunk services: | Destination | Description | | --- | --- | | Splunk HEC | Stream data to a Splunk HEC receiver | | Splunk Single Instance | Stre...
- [Splunk HEC Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-splunk-hec/index.md): Stream data to a Splunk HEC receiver
- [Splunk Single Instance Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-splunk/index.md): Stream data to a Splunk instance
- [Splunk Load Balanced Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-splunk-lb/index.md): Load-balance data streaming to multiple Splunk receivers
- [CrowdStrike Falcon LogScale Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-humio-hec/index.md): Stream data to a CrowdStrike Falcon LogScale HTTP Event Collector
- [ClickHouse Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-click-house/index.md): Send events to ClickHouse
- [Cloudflare R2 Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-cloudflare-r2/index.md): Send data to Cloudflare R2 object storage using an S3-compatible API
- [Cortex XSIAM Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-xsiam/index.md): Stream data to Palo Alto’s Cortex XSIAM platform
- [CrowdStrike Falcon Next-Gen SIEM Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-crowdstrike-next-gen-siem/index.md): Stream data to a CrowdStrike Falcon Next-Gen SIEM
- [Databricks Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-databricks/index.md): Sends data to Databricks Unity Catalog volumes
- [Datadog Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-datadog/index.md): Send log and metric events to Datadog
- [Dynatrace HTTP Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-dynatrace-http/index.md): Send logs to Dynatrace
- [Dynatrace OTLP](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-dynatrace-otlp/index.md): Send telemetry data to Dynatrace using OTLP
- [Exabeam Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-exabeam/index.md): Send data to Exabeam SIEM
- [Fabric Real-Time Intelligence](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-fabric-real-time-intelligence/index.md): Send data to Microsoft Fabric Eventstreams
- [Filesystem/NFS Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-fs/index.md): Output files to a local file system or NFS
- [Honeycomb Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-honeycomb/index.md): Send events to a Honeycomb dataset
- [InfluxDB Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-influxdb/index.md): Send data to InfluxDB and InfluxDB Cloud
- [MinIO Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-minio/index.md): Send objects to MinIO buckets
- [NetFlow Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-netflow/index.md): Send data to NetFlow
- [OpenTelemetry (OTel) Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-otel/index.md): Send events to OTLP-compliant targets
- [SentinelOne AI SIEM Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-sentinel-one-ai-siem/index.md): Stream data to SentinelOne’s AI SIEM platform
- [SentinelOne DataSet Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-dataset/index.md): Send log events to SentinelOne DataSet
- [ServiceNow Cloud Observability](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-servicenow/index.md): Send events to ServiceNow Cloud Observability
- [SignalFx Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-signalfx/index.md): Send events to SignalFx
- [SNMP Trap Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-snmp-traps/index.md): Forward SNMP Traps out
- [Sumo Logic Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-sumo-logic/index.md): Send log and metric events to Sumo Logic over HTTP
- [Syslog Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-syslog/index.md): Send out data over syslog via TCP or UDP
- [TCP JSON Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-tcp-json/index.md): Send data over TCP in JSON format
- [Wavefront Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-wavefront/index.md): Send events to Wavefront analytics
- [Webhook Destination](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-webhook/index.md): Send log and metric events to webhooks and generic HTTP endpoints
- [Manage Backpressure](http://localhost:4444/edge/manage-backpressure/index.md): Learn how to use Cribl to manage backpressure events and prevent data loss
- [About Persistent Queues](http://localhost:4444/edge/persistent-queues/index.md): Learn how persistent queues prevent data loss
- [Optimize Source Persistent Queues](http://localhost:4444/edge/persistent-queues-sources/index.md): This page explains choices to consider when enabling Source persistent queues in your system.
- [Optimize Destination Persistent Queues](http://localhost:4444/edge/persistent-queues-destinations/index.md): This page explains choices to consider when enabling Destination persistent queues in your system
- [About Destination Backpressure Triggers](http://localhost:4444/edge/destinations-backpressure-triggers/index.md): This page documents backpressure triggers and behavior in Cribl Stream and Cribl Edge Destinations.
- [About Load Balancing](http://localhost:4444/edge/load-balancing/index.md): Details about configuring load balancing on Cribl Destinations
- [Cribl Edge to Cribl Stream](http://localhost:4444/edge/usecase-edge-stream/index.md): Sending data from Cribl Edge to Cribl Stream
- [Transfer Data Between Workspaces or Environments](http://localhost:4444/edge/usecase-transfer-data/index.md): Transfer data between Cribl.Cloud Workspaces or on-prem Cribl environments without paying twice.
- [Integrating with Other Services](http://localhost:4444/edge/integrating-other/index.md): The following topics provide detailed guides and better practice for integrating with different external services.
- [Cribl Edge as a Sidecar Container in AWS ECS](http://localhost:4444/edge/usecase-edge-aws/index.md): Cribl Edge as a Sidecar Container in AWS ECS
- [Amazon Security Lake Integration](http://localhost:4444/edge/usecase-security-lake/index.md): Integrate Cribl Edge's Amazon Security Lake Destination with its Namesake Service
- [Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Services (EKS) Add-On for Edge](http://localhost:4444/edge/usecase-edge-aws-eks/index.md): Use Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Services Add-On to track cost of Kubernetes application in the AWS Cloud
- [Monitoring Health and Metrics](http://localhost:4444/edge/monitoring/index.md): Monitor health and metrics in Cribl Edge
- [Internal Metrics](http://localhost:4444/edge/internal-metrics/index.md): Description of internal metrics
- [Internal Logs](http://localhost:4444/edge/internal-logs/index.md): A guide to the internal logs available on Cribl Leaders, Worker and Edge Nodes, and single-instance deployments.
- [Tracking Data Activity for an Edge Node](http://localhost:4444/edge/node-data-activity/index.md): Monitor and troubleshoot Edge Node activity
- [Working with Data](http://localhost:4444/edge/working-with-data/index.md): Process and route observability data before delivering them to Cribl Stream
- [Event Model](http://localhost:4444/edge/event-model/index.md): Learn how Cribl Edge represents and captures events
- [Event Processing Order](http://localhost:4444/edge/event-processing-order/index.md): Flow of events processing in Cribl Edge
- [Routes](http://localhost:4444/edge/routes/index.md): Filter, clone, and cascade incoming data across Pipelines and Destinations
- [Pipelines](http://localhost:4444/edge/pipelines/index.md): Use Pipelines to process data passed via Routes between Sources and Destinations
- [Data Preview](http://localhost:4444/edge/data-preview/index.md): Visually inspect events as they flow into and out of a Pipeline
- [Process Data with AI Assistance](http://localhost:4444/edge/copilot-editor/index.md): Learn how to build Pipelines and process data with AI assistance
- [Create Pipelines With Cribl Copilot Editor](http://localhost:4444/edge/copilot-editor-pipelines/index.md): Use the Cribl Copilot Editor to build effective Pipelines
- [Convert Data into a Custom Schema](http://localhost:4444/edge/copilot-editor-custom-schemas/index.md): Use the Cribl Copilot Editor to convert data to match a custom schema that you define
- [Packs](http://localhost:4444/edge/packs/index.md): Pack up and share configurations and workflows across organizations or Worker Groups
- [Import Packs](http://localhost:4444/edge/packs-import/index.md): Share simple or complex configurations
- [Share Packs](http://localhost:4444/edge/packs-share-config/index.md): Share simple or complex configurations
- [Collaborate on Developing Packs](http://localhost:4444/edge/packs-collaborate/index.md): Share simple or complex configurations
- [Packs Publication Standards](http://localhost:4444/edge/packs-standards/index.md): How Cribl Community members can create and publish Cribl Packs
- [Using Datagens](http://localhost:4444/edge/datagens/index.md): Data generators for testing and troubleshooting
- [Manage Metrics and High Cardinality](http://localhost:4444/edge/manage-metrics/index.md): Strategies for handling high-cardinality metrics and improving data efficiency
- [Data Onboarding](http://localhost:4444/edge/data-onboarding/index.md): Bringing data into Cribl Edge
- [Build Custom Logic to Route and Process Your Data](http://localhost:4444/edge/filter-and-transform-data/index.md): How to use JavaScript Expressions to filter, route, and transform data
- [Functions](http://localhost:4444/edge/functions/index.md): All about Cribl Functions
- [Aggregations](http://localhost:4444/edge/aggregations-function/index.md): Aggregate events in real time
- [Aggregate Metrics](http://localhost:4444/edge/aggregate-metrics-function/index.md): Aggregate metrics and metric events in real time
- [Auto Timestamp](http://localhost:4444/edge/auto-timestamp-function/index.md): Extract timestamps
- [CEF Serializer](http://localhost:4444/edge/cef-serializer-function/index.md): Serialize events to CEF format for a SIEM
- [Chain](http://localhost:4444/edge/chain-function/index.md): Chain data processing from one Pipeline or Pack to another
- [Clone](http://localhost:4444/edge/clone-function/index.md): Duplicate events in the same Pipeline, optionally adding fields
- [Code](http://localhost:4444/edge/code-function/index.md): Encapsulate your own JavaScript code in a Function
- [Comment](http://localhost:4444/edge/comment-function/index.md): Add a text comment within a Pipeline's UI
- [DNS Lookup](http://localhost:4444/edge/dns-lookup-function/index.md): Perform reverse DNS lookups, or DNS lookups based on host name
- [Drop](http://localhost:4444/edge/drop-function/index.md): Drop events
- [Drop Dimensions](http://localhost:4444/edge/drop-dimensions-function/index.md): Drop dimensions from metrics and metric events
- [Dynamic Sampling](http://localhost:4444/edge/dynamic-sampling-function/index.md): Sample events (e.g, high-volume, low-value data)
- [Eval](http://localhost:4444/edge/eval-function/index.md): Add or remove event fields
- [Event Breaker](http://localhost:4444/edge/event-breaker-function/index.md): Break events within a Pipeline
- [Flatten](http://localhost:4444/edge/flatten-function/index.md): Flatten nested structures (e.g., nested JSON)
- [Fold Keys](http://localhost:4444/edge/fold-keys-function/index.md): Convert key names with separators into nested fields
- [GeoIP](http://localhost:4444/edge/geoip-function/index.md): Add GeoIP information to events
- [Grok](http://localhost:4444/edge/grok-function/index.md): Extract structured fields from unstructured log data, using modular regex patterns
- [JSON Unroll](http://localhost:4444/edge/json-unroll-function/index.md): Convert JSON arrays into their own events
- [Lookup](http://localhost:4444/edge/lookup-function/index.md): Use lookup tables to transform events
- [Mask](http://localhost:4444/edge/mask-function/index.md): Remove sensitive data from events
- [Numerify](http://localhost:4444/edge/numerify-function/index.md): Extract numeric values from event fields
- [OTLP Logs](http://localhost:4444/edge/otlp-logs-function/index.md): Format logs to OTLP
- [OTLP Metrics](http://localhost:4444/edge/otlp-metrics-function/index.md): Format metrics to OTLP
- [OTLP Traces](http://localhost:4444/edge/otlp-traces-function/index.md): Format traces to OTLP
- [Parser](http://localhost:4444/edge/parser-function/index.md): Extract fields
- [Publish Metrics](http://localhost:4444/edge/publish-metrics-function/index.md): Convert events to metrics format
- [Redis](http://localhost:4444/edge/redis-function/index.md): Use a Redis store to accelerate lookups
- [Regex Extract](http://localhost:4444/edge/regex-extract-function/index.md): Extract fields using regex
- [Regex Filter](http://localhost:4444/edge/regex-filter-function/index.md): Drop events using regex
- [Rename](http://localhost:4444/edge/rename-function/index.md): Change or reformat field names individually or in bulk
- [Rollup Metrics](http://localhost:4444/edge/rollup-metrics-function/index.md): Merge/roll up frequently generated metrics into more manageable time windows
- [Sampling](http://localhost:4444/edge/sampling-function/index.md): Sample events (e.g, high-volume, low-value data)
- [Serialize](http://localhost:4444/edge/serialize-function/index.md): Serialize/change format (e.g., convert JSON to CSV)
- [SNMP Trap Serialize](http://localhost:4444/edge/snmp-trap-serialize-function/index.md): Serializes compliant events into SNMP traps
- [Suppress](http://localhost:4444/edge/suppress-function/index.md): Suppress events (e.g, duplicates, etc.)
- [Tee](http://localhost:4444/edge/tee-function/index.md): Send events out to a command or a local file from any point in a Pipeline
- [Unroll](http://localhost:4444/edge/unroll-function/index.md): Break/unroll an array into individual events
- [XML Unroll](http://localhost:4444/edge/xml-unroll-function/index.md): Convert an XML event's elements into individual events
- [Windows SID Lookup](http://localhost:4444/edge/windows-sidlookup-function/index.md): Translate Windows SIDs into account names
- [Prometheus Publisher (deprecated)](http://localhost:4444/edge/prometheus-publisher-function/index.md): Convert events to metrics format
- [Reverse DNS (deprecated)](http://localhost:4444/edge/reverse-dns-function/index.md): Resolve hostname from IP address
- [Trim Timestamp (deprecated)](http://localhost:4444/edge/trim-timestamp-function/index.md): Remove timestamps patterns from events, and optionally store them in fields
- [Knowledge Libraries](http://localhost:4444/edge/knowledge-library/index.md): Knowledge objects overview
- [Lookups Library](http://localhost:4444/edge/lookups-library/index.md): Use these data tables to enrich events processed by the Lookup Function
- [Event Breakers](http://localhost:4444/edge/event-breakers/index.md): Break incoming streams of data into discrete events
- [Parsers Library](http://localhost:4444/edge/parsers-library/index.md): Library of parsers for use within Parser Functions
- [Variables Library](http://localhost:4444/edge/global-variables-library/index.md): Use and reuse these JavaScript expressions in Functions in any Pipeline
- [Regex Library](http://localhost:4444/edge/regex-library/index.md): A set of pre-built common regex patterns
- [Grok Patterns Library](http://localhost:4444/edge/grok-patterns-library/index.md): Library of patterns for use within Grok Functions
- [Schemas Library](http://localhost:4444/edge/schema-library/index.md): Schemas for validating inbound JSON events and writing out Parquet data
- [Parquet Schemas](http://localhost:4444/edge/parquet-schemas/index.md): Schemas for writing out Parquet data
- [AppScope Configs](http://localhost:4444/edge/appscope-configs/index.md): AppScope config library
- [Reference](http://localhost:4444/edge/reference/index.md): Consult reference for Cribl Edge, including Cribl Expressions, commands, environment variables, and configuration files
- [Cribl Expressions](http://localhost:4444/edge/cribl-reference/index.md): Native Cribl Edge methods, found under C.*
- [C.Crypto](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-crypto/index.md): Native Cribl methods for encryption and decryption
- [C.Decode and C.Encode](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-encode-decode/index.md): Native Cribl methods for encoding and decoding
- [C.Lookup](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-lookup/index.md): Native Cribl methods for lookups
- [C.Mask](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-mask/index.md): Native Cribl methods for masking
- [C.Net](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-net/index.md): Native Cribl methods for encryption and decryption
- [C.Text](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-text/index.md): Native Cribl methods for text manipulation
- [C.Time](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-time/index.md): Native Cribl methods for time
- [Other expressions](http://localhost:4444/edge/expressions-other/index.md): Miscellaneous native Cribl methods
- [String](http://localhost:4444/edge/string-reference/index.md): How to use JavaScript strings in Cribl expressions
- [Date](http://localhost:4444/edge/date-reference/index.md): How to use Cribl Expressions as inputs to Cribl Functions
- [Math](http://localhost:4444/edge/math-reference/index.md): The Math JavaScript object, and its methods
- [Number](http://localhost:4444/edge/number-reference/index.md): The Number JavaScript object, and its methods
- [CLI Reference](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-reference/index.md): Command line interface basics
- [auth](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-auth/index.md): Command to log into or out of the product
- [boot-start](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-boot-start/index.md): Command to enable or disable product boot-start
- [cloud-workspace](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-cloud-workspace/index.md): Command to update a Leader with new config that allows it to connect to the Cribl.Cloud Leader and send it usage metrics
- [decrypt](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-decrypt/index.md): Command to decrypt data with a secret key
- [diag](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-diag/index.md): Command to manage diagnostic bundles
- [encrypt](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-encrypt/index.md): Command to encrypt data with a secret key
- [git](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-git/index.md): Command to manage Worker Group or Fleet configuration
- [help](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-help/index.md): Displays a list of commands and their help
- [keys](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-keys/index.md): Command to manage encryption keys
- [limits](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-limits/index.md): Command to control the availability of Cribl features
- [mode-master](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-mode-master/index.md): Command to configure an instance as a Leader
- [mode-single](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-mode-single/index.md): Command to configure an instance as a Single-instance deployment
- [mode-edge](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-mode-edge/index.md): Command to configure Cribl Edge as a Single-instance deployment
- [mode-worker](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-mode-worker/index.md): Command to configure Cribl Stream as a Worker instance
- [mode-managed-edge](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-mode-managed-edge/index.md): Command to configure Cribl Edge as an Edge Node
- [mode-outpost](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-mode-outpost/index.md): Command to configure an instance as an Outpost Node
- [nc](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-nc/index.md): Command to listen a port for traffic and output stats and data
- [node](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-node/index.md): Command to execute a JavaScript file
- [pack](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-pack/index.md): Command to mange Cribl packs
- [parquet](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-parquet/index.md): Command to view a Parquet file, its metadata, or its schema
- [pipe](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-pipe/index.md): Command to feed stdin to a Pipeline
- [pq](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-pq/index.md): Command for persistent queue performance benchmarking
- [reload](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-reload/index.md): Command to reload the product
- [restart](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-restart/index.md): Command to restart the product
- [scope](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-scope/index.md): Scope a Linux Command via AppScope
- [start](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-start/index.md): Command to start the product
- [status](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-status/index.md): Command to display the product status
- [stop](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-stop/index.md): Command to stop the product
- [vars](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-vars/index.md): Command to manage global variables
- [version](http://localhost:4444/edge/cli-version/index.md): Command to display product version
- [Environment Variables](http://localhost:4444/edge/environment-variables/index.md): Environment variables available for configuring Cribl Edge
- [Configuration Files](http://localhost:4444/edge/configuration-files/index.md): How configuration paths and files are laid out on the filesystem
- [breakers.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/breakersyml/index.md): Config file where Cribl's default Event Breaker Library is stored
- [certificates.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/certificatesyml/index.md): Config file that lists configured certificates and their parameters
- [cribl.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/criblyml/index.md): Config file that contains system properties, and API settings
- [groups.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/groupsyml/index.md): Config file that lists groups and their configuration versions
- [inputs.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/inputsyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for configuring inputs to Cribl
- [instance.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/instanceyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for Leader, Worker, and Single instances
- [jobs.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/jobsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for configured Collectors
- [job-limits.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/job-limitsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for Collector jobs
- [leader.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/leaderyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for secondary Leader when failover is configured
- [limits.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/limitsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for system tasks
- [logger.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/loggeryml/index.md): Config file that maintains logging levels and redactions, per channel
- [mappings.yml and fleet-mappings.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/mappingsyml/index.md): Config file that lists mapping ruleset configurations
- [messages.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/messagesyml/index.md): Config file that stores messages displayed in the UI's Messages fly-out
- [notifications.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/notificationsyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for configuring Notifications.
- [outpost.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/outpostyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for a Cribl Outpost instance
- [outputs.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/outputsyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for Cribl Edge Destinations
- [parsers.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/parsersyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for Cribl Edge Destinations
- [persistent-queue.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/persistent-queueyml/index.md): Config file that contains settings for configuring persistent queues.
- [regexes.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/regexesyml/index.md): Config file that lists regexes, including (by default) the Cribl Regex Library
- [samples.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/samplesyml/index.md): Config file that contains metadata about stored sample data files
- [schemas.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/schemasyml/index.md): Config file that describes schemas in the Knowledge > Schema Library
- [scripts.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/scriptsyml/index.md): Config file that contains parameters for scripts
- [service.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/serviceyml/index.md): service.yml maintains configuration for Cribl Stream and Cribl Edge service processes
- [vars.yml](http://localhost:4444/edge/varsyml/index.md): Config file that contains global variables
- [Kubernetes Metrics Details](http://localhost:4444/edge/system-metrics-kubernetes-output/index.md): Reference of System Metrics Source output in Kubernetes
- [Linux System Metrics Details](http://localhost:4444/edge/system-metrics-linux-output/index.md): Reference of System Metrics Source output on Linux
- [Windows System Metrics Details](http://localhost:4444/edge/system-metrics-windows-output/index.md): Reference of System Metrics Source output on Windows
- [Troubleshooting](http://localhost:4444/edge/troubleshooting/index.md): Overview of troubleshooting resources for Cribl Edge
- [Known Issues](http://localhost:4444/edge/known-issues/index.md): Issues affecting Cribl Cribl Edge, with workarounds and fix versions
- [Common Challenges on the Edge](http://localhost:4444/edge/edge-common-challenges/index.md): Common issues you can encounter in Cribl Edge and how to resolve them
- [Diagnosing Issues](http://localhost:4444/edge/diagnosing/index.md): Diagnosing issues and exporting a diagnostic bundle

## Cribl Search

- [About Cribl Search](http://localhost:4444/search/about/index.md): Basic overview of Cribl Search
- [Basic Concepts](http://localhost:4444/search/basic-concepts/index.md): Introduction to Cribl Search basic concepts, terminology, and usage relationships
- [Quick Setup](http://localhost:4444/search/getting-started-guide/index.md): How to get started with Cribl Search
- [Cribl Search Tour](http://localhost:4444/search/search-overview/index.md): Cribl Search tour – an overview of the product's UI
- [Connect Cribl Search to Your Data](http://localhost:4444/search/connect-to-data/index.md): Connect Cribl Search to your data sources
- [Connect Cribl Search to Cribl Lake](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-cribl-lake/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query your Cribl Lake data
- [Connect Cribl Search to Amazon S3](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-s3/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query to your Amazon S3 data
- [Connect Cribl Search to Cribl Edge](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-edge/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query your Cribl Edge Nodes
- [Connect Cribl Search to AWS](http://localhost:4444/search/connect-to-aws/index.md): Connect Cribl Search to AWS data sources
- [Grant Access to AWS](http://localhost:4444/search/aws-access/index.md): Allow Cribl Search to access your AWS data
- [Connect Cribl Search to Amazon Security Lake](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-amazon-security-lake/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query your Amazon Security Lake data
- [Connect Cribl Search to AWS API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-aws/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query an AWS API endpoint
- [Connect Cribl Search to Data Lake Amazon S3](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-data-lake-amazon-s3/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query Cribl Stream's Data Lake Amazon S3 Destination
- [Connect Cribl Search to Azure](http://localhost:4444/search/connect-to-azure/index.md): Connect Cribl Search to Microsoft Azure data sources
- [Connect Cribl Search to Azure Blob Storage](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-azure-blob/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query your Azure Blob Storage data
- [Connect Cribl Search to Azure Data Explorer](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-azure-data-explorer/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query Azure Data Explorer
- [Connect Cribl Search to Azure API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-azure-api/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query an Azure API endpoint
- [Connect Cribl Search to Google](http://localhost:4444/search/connect-to-google/index.md): Connect Cribl Search to Google data sources
- [Connect Cribl Search to Google Cloud Storage](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-google-cloud-storage/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query your Google Cloud Storage data
- [Connect Cribl Search to Google Cloud Platform API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-google-cloud-platform/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query a Google Cloud Platform API endpoint
- [Connect Cribl Search to Google Workspace API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-google-workspace-api/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query a Google Workspace API endpoint
- [Connect Cribl Search to ClickHouse](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-clickhouse/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query ClickHouse Cloud or a self-managed ClickHouse server
- [Connect Cribl Search to Elasticsearch](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-elasticsearch/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query an Elasticsearch index
- [Connect Cribl Search to a Generic HTTP API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-generic-http-api/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query any HTTP API
- [Connect Cribl Search to Microsoft Graph API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-microsoft-graph-api/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query a Microsoft Graph API endpoint
- [Connect Cribl Search to Okta API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-okta/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query an Okta API endpoint
- [Connect Cribl Search to OpenSearch](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-opensearch/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query an OpenSearch index
- [Connect Cribl Search to Prometheus](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-prometheus/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query your Prometheus instance
- [Connect Cribl Search to Snowflake](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-snowflake/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query your Snowflake warehouse
- [Connect Cribl Search to Tailscale API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-tailscale/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query a Tailscale API endpoint
- [Connect Cribl Search to Zoom API](http://localhost:4444/search/set-up-zoom/index.md): Configure Cribl Search to query a Zoom API endpoint
- [Configure Data Connection Options in Cribl Search](http://localhost:4444/search/configure/index.md): Process data into discrete events, and control your object storage costs
- [Datatypes](http://localhost:4444/search/datatypes/index.md): Make searching easier by processing data into discrete events and defining fields
- [Storage Classes](http://localhost:4444/search/storage-classes/index.md): Control costs by selectively enabling storage classes (access tiers) to search, per Dataset
- [Supported Data Formats](http://localhost:4444/search/data-formats/index.md): Learn about how Cribl Search processes the most common data formats
- [Search Your Data](http://localhost:4444/search/search-your-data/index.md): Learn how to search data with Cribl Search
- [Build a Search](http://localhost:4444/search/build-a-search/index.md): How to build a search
- [Write Your First Query](http://localhost:4444/search/your-first-query/index.md): Learn how to write a query using Cribl Search
- [Write Queries Using Cribl Copilot](http://localhost:4444/search/copilot-kql/index.md): Use the Cribl Copilot KQL assistant to translate natural language into Cribl Search queries
- [Common Query Examples](http://localhost:4444/search/common-examples/index.md): Common uses of Cribl Search
- [Use Search Results](http://localhost:4444/search/search-results/index.md): Export, share, reuse, and manage Cribl Search results

- [KQL Extensions](http://localhost:4444/search/kql-cribl/index.md): Understand KQL variations from Kusto
- [Lakehouse Search Differences](http://localhost:4444/search/lakehouse-differences/index.md): Identify differences in Cribl Search behavior when querying Datasets with and without Lakehouse caching

- [Common Issues and Resolutions](http://localhost:4444/search/common-issues/index.md): Common issues, diagnostics, and resolutions in working with Cribl Search
- [Language Reference](http://localhost:4444/search/language-reference/index.md): A comprehensive reference for the Cribl Search implementation of KQL
- [Language Reference Index](http://localhost:4444/search/language-index/index.md): An alphabetical, linked index to all operators, functions, and other elements of the Cribl Search KQL implementation
- [Operators in Cribl Search](http://localhost:4444/search/operators/index.md): A list of operators supported by Cribl Search
- [Aggregation Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/aggregation-operators/index.md): A list of aggregation operators supported by Cribl Search
- [count](http://localhost:4444/search/operators-count/index.md): Count the number of events
- [eventstats](http://localhost:4444/search/eventstats/index.md): Enrich your events with aggregated data
- [summarize](http://localhost:4444/search/summarize/index.md): Aggregate your data
- [timestats](http://localhost:4444/search/timestats/index.md): Aggregate by time periods or bins
- [Data Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/data-operators/index.md): A list of data operators supported by Cribl Search
- [centralize](http://localhost:4444/search/centralize/index.md): Force subsequent operators to the coordinator
- [export](http://localhost:4444/search/export/index.md): Send Cribl Search results to a Cribl Lake Dataset or to a lookup
- [extend](http://localhost:4444/search/extend/index.md): Append fields created by calculating expressions
- [externaldata](http://localhost:4444/search/externaldata/index.md): Fetches external data from HTTP(S) URLs, including public APIs
- [extract](http://localhost:4444/search/extract-operator/index.md): Extracts data
- [foldkeys](http://localhost:4444/search/foldkeys/index.md): Fold hierarchical field names into a nested structure
- [ip-lookup](http://localhost:4444/search/ip-lookup/index.md): Enrich events with IP address data
- [join](http://localhost:4444/search/join/index.md): Merge events from different Datasets, using the join operator
- [lookup](http://localhost:4444/search/lookup/index.md): Enrich events with lookups
- [mv-expand](http://localhost:4444/search/mv-expand/index.md): Expand an object into multiple events
- [mv-pull](http://localhost:4444/search/mv-pull/index.md): Pull key-value pairs into a top-level event, or into a dedicated object or bag
- [pivot](http://localhost:4444/search/pivot/index.md): Turn field values into field names.
- [send](http://localhost:4444/search/send/index.md): Send search results to Cribl Stream
- [top-hitters](http://localhost:4444/search/top-hitters/index.md): Count the most frequent values
- [union](http://localhost:4444/search/union/index.md): Append one set of results to another
- [Display Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/display-operators/index.md): A list of display operators supported by Cribl Search
- [limit](http://localhost:4444/search/limit/index.md): Limit the number of events
- [order](http://localhost:4444/search/order/index.md): Arrange events
- [print](http://localhost:4444/search/print/index.md): Evaluate one or more scalar expressions
- [project](http://localhost:4444/search/project/index.md): Define fields to return
- [project-away](http://localhost:4444/search/project-away/index.md): Exclude fields from the results
- [project-rename](http://localhost:4444/search/project-rename/index.md): Rename fields
- [range](http://localhost:4444/search/range-operator/index.md): Generate a series of events with a defined range of generated values
- [render](http://localhost:4444/search/render/index.md): Choose how to render the results of your search.
- [sort](http://localhost:4444/search/sort/index.md): Arrange events
- [take](http://localhost:4444/search/take/index.md): Take a number of events
- [top](http://localhost:4444/search/top/index.md): Get the first N events
- [Filter Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/filter-operators/index.md): A list of filter operators supported by Cribl Search
- [dedup](http://localhost:4444/search/dedup/index.md): Deduplicate events
- [distinct](http://localhost:4444/search/distinct/index.md): Find unique field values
- [search](http://localhost:4444/search/search/index.md): Find events with specific text strings
- [where](http://localhost:4444/search/where/index.md): Filter specific events
- [Logical Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/logical-operators/index.md): A list of logical operators supported by Cribl Search
- [Numerical Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/numerical-operators/index.md): A list of numerical operators supported by Cribl Search
- [Search Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/search-operators/index.md): A list of search operators supported by Cribl Search
- [cribl](http://localhost:4444/search/cribl/index.md): Find your data
- [find](http://localhost:4444/search/find/index.md): Find your data
- [String Operators](http://localhost:4444/search/string-operators/index.md): A list of string operators that Cribl Search supports
- [==](http://localhost:4444/search/equals-cs/index.md): Equal
- [!=](http://localhost:4444/search/not-equals-cs/index.md): Not equal
- [=~](http://localhost:4444/search/equals/index.md): Equal case-insensitive
- [!~](http://localhost:4444/search/not-equals/index.md): Not equal case-insensitive
- [contains](http://localhost:4444/search/contains/index.md): Right occurs as a subsequence of left
- [!contains](http://localhost:4444/search/not-contains/index.md): Right doesn't occur in the left
- [contains_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/contains-cs/index.md): Right occurs as a subsequence of left
- [!contains_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/not-contains-cs/index.md): Right doesn't occur in the left
- [endswith](http://localhost:4444/search/endswith/index.md): Right is a closing subsequence of the left
- [!endswith](http://localhost:4444/search/not-endswith/index.md): Right isn't a closing subsequence of the left
- [endswith_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/endswith-cs/index.md): Right is a closing subsequence of the left
- [!endswith_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/not-endswith-cs/index.md): Right isn't a closing subsequence of the left
- [has](http://localhost:4444/search/has/index.md): Right occurs in the left
- [!has](http://localhost:4444/search/not-has/index.md): Right doesn't occur in the left
- [has_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/has-cs/index.md): Right occurs in the left
- [!has_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/not-has-cs/index.md): Right doesn't occur in the left
- [has_all](http://localhost:4444/search/has-all/index.md): Same as has but works on all of the elements
- [!has_all](http://localhost:4444/search/not-has-all/index.md): Same as !has but works on all of the elements
- [has_any](http://localhost:4444/search/has-any/index.md): Same as has but works on any of the elements
- [!has_any](http://localhost:4444/search/not-has-any/index.md): Same as !has but works on any of the elements
- [hasprefix](http://localhost:4444/search/hasprefix/index.md): Right is a term prefix in the left
- [!hasprefix](http://localhost:4444/search/not-hasprefix/index.md): Right isn't a term prefix in the left
- [hasprefix_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/hasprefix-cs/index.md): Right isn't a term prefix in the left
- [!hasprefix_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/not-hasprefix-cs/index.md): Right isn't a term prefix in the left
- [hassuffix](http://localhost:4444/search/hassuffix/index.md): Right is a term suffix in the left
- [!hassuffix](http://localhost:4444/search/not-hassuffix/index.md): Right isn't a term suffix in the left
- [hassuffix_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/hassuffix-cs/index.md): Right is a term suffix in the left
- [!hassuffix_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/not-hassuffix-cs/index.md): Right isn't a term suffix in the left
- [in](http://localhost:4444/search/in-cs/index.md): Equal to any of the events
- [!in](http://localhost:4444/search/not-in-cs/index.md): Not equal to any of the events
- [in~](http://localhost:4444/search/in/index.md): Equal to any of the events
- [!in~](http://localhost:4444/search/not-in/index.md): Not equal to any of the events
- [matches regex](http://localhost:4444/search/matches-regex/index.md): Matches against a field with a regex
- [startswith](http://localhost:4444/search/startswith/index.md): Right is an initial subsequence of the left
- [!startswith](http://localhost:4444/search/not-startswith/index.md): Right isn't an initial subsequence of the left
- [startswith_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/startswith-cs/index.md): Right is an initial subsequence of the left
- [!startswith_cs](http://localhost:4444/search/not-startswith-cs/index.md): Right isn't an initial subsequence of the left
- [Commands](http://localhost:4444/search/commands/index.md): Commands supported by Cribl Search
- [.cancel](http://localhost:4444/search/cancel/index.md): Cancel queued or running searches
- [.clear options](http://localhost:4444/search/clear-options/index.md): Disable set-statement options
- [.generate stats](http://localhost:4444/search/generate-stats/index.md): Produce statistics about a search's results
- [.show objects](http://localhost:4444/search/show-objects/index.md): List objects included in a Dataset
- [.show options](http://localhost:4444/search/show-options/index.md): List set-statement options configured for your account
- [.show queries](http://localhost:4444/search/show-queries/index.md): List queued and running searches
- [Statements](http://localhost:4444/search/statements/index.md): A list of special statements supported by Cribl Search
- [let](http://localhost:4444/search/let/index.md): Assign names to values, expressions, or entire queries, using the let statement
- [set](http://localhost:4444/search/set/index.md): Use set statements to configure search options
- [Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/functions/index.md): A list of all functions supported by Cribl Search
- [Context Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/context-functions/index.md): Get contextual information on your search
- [Cribl Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/cribl-functions/index.md): A list of additional functions supported by Cribl Search
- [findearliest](http://localhost:4444/search/findearliest/index.md): Get the earliest value
- [findearliestif](http://localhost:4444/search/findearliestif/index.md): Get the earliest value of specific events
- [findfirst](http://localhost:4444/search/findfirst/index.md): Get the first observed value
- [findfirstif](http://localhost:4444/search/findfirstif/index.md): Get the first observed value of specific events
- [findlast](http://localhost:4444/search/findlast/index.md): Get the last observed value
- [findlastif](http://localhost:4444/search/findlastif/index.md): Get the last observed value of specific events
- [findlatest](http://localhost:4444/search/findlatest/index.md): Get the latest value
- [findlatestif](http://localhost:4444/search/findlatestif/index.md): Get the latest value of specific events
- [list](http://localhost:4444/search/list/index.md): Get a list of values
- [median](http://localhost:4444/search/median/index.md): Get the middle value
- [medianif](http://localhost:4444/search/medianif/index.md): Get the middle value of specific events
- [persecond](http://localhost:4444/search/persecond/index.md): Get the per second rate
- [persecondif](http://localhost:4444/search/persecondif/index.md): Get the per second rate of specific events
- [rate](http://localhost:4444/search/rate/index.md): Get the rate observed value
- [rateif](http://localhost:4444/search/rateif/index.md): Get the rate observed value of specific events
- [sumsq](http://localhost:4444/search/sumsq/index.md): Get the sum of squares
- [sumsqif](http://localhost:4444/search/sumsqif/index.md): Get the sum of squares of specific events
- [values](http://localhost:4444/search/values/index.md): Get distinct values
- [Scalar Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/scalar-functions/index.md): A list of all scalar functions supported by Cribl Search
- [Binary Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/binary-functions/index.md): A list of all binary functions supported by Cribl Search
- [binary_and](http://localhost:4444/search/binary-and/index.md): Get the bitwise and between two numbers
- [binary_not](http://localhost:4444/search/binary-not/index.md): Get the bitwise negation of a number
- [binary_or](http://localhost:4444/search/binary-or/index.md): Get bitwise or of two values
- [binary_shift_left](http://localhost:4444/search/binary-shift-left/index.md): Get the binary shift left on a pair of numbers
- [binary_shift_right](http://localhost:4444/search/binary-shift-right/index.md): Get the binary shift right on a pair of numbers
- [binary_xor](http://localhost:4444/search/binary-xor/index.md): Get the bitwise xor on a pair of numbers
- [from_binary_string](http://localhost:4444/search/from-binary-string/index.md): Returns a number from a binary string
- [to_binary_string](http://localhost:4444/search/to-binary-string/index.md): Returns a binary string from a number
- [Conditional Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/conditional-functions/index.md): A list of all conditional functions supported by Cribl Search
- [case](http://localhost:4444/search/case/index.md): Evaluates a list of predicates and returns the first result expression whose predicate is satisfied
- [coalesce](http://localhost:4444/search/coalesce/index.md): Evaluates a list of expressions and returns the first non-null (or non-empty for string) expression
- [iff](http://localhost:4444/search/iff/index.md): Evaluates the first argument (the predicate), and returns the value of either the second or third arguments, depending on whether the predicate evaluated to true (second) or false (third)
- [iif](http://localhost:4444/search/iif/index.md): Evaluates the first argument (the predicate), and returns the value of either the second or third arguments, depending on whether the predicate evaluated to true (second) or false (third)
- [max_of](http://localhost:4444/search/max-of/index.md): Returns the maximum value of several evaluated numeric expressions
- [min_of](http://localhost:4444/search/min-of/index.md): Returns the minimum value of several evaluated numeric expressions
- [Conversion Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/conversion-functions/index.md): A list of all conversion functions supported by Cribl Search
- [bin](http://localhost:4444/search/bin/index.md): Round events into bins
- [bin_auto](http://localhost:4444/search/bin-auto/index.md): Round events into bins
- [floor](http://localhost:4444/search/floor/index.md): Round events into floors
- [gettype](http://localhost:4444/search/gettype/index.md): Returns the type of the input value
- [tobool](http://localhost:4444/search/tobool/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type bool
- [todecimal](http://localhost:4444/search/todecimal/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type decimal (double, real)
- [todouble](http://localhost:4444/search/todouble/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type double (real, decimal)
- [toint](http://localhost:4444/search/toint/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type int (long)
- [tolong](http://localhost:4444/search/tolong/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type long (int)
- [toreal](http://localhost:4444/search/toreal/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type real (double, decimal)
- [tostring](http://localhost:4444/search/tostring/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type string
- [DateTime Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/datetime-functions/index.md): A list of all DateTime functions supported by Cribl Search
- [ago](http://localhost:4444/search/ago/index.md): Subtracts from UTC
- [datetime_add](http://localhost:4444/search/datetime-add/index.md): Add dates
- [datetime_diff](http://localhost:4444/search/datetime-diff/index.md): Extract a diff of a date as an integer
- [datetime_part](http://localhost:4444/search/datetime-part/index.md): Extract a part of a date as an integer
- [dayofmonth](http://localhost:4444/search/dayofmonth/index.md): Get the day number of the month
- [dayofweek](http://localhost:4444/search/dayofweek/index.md): The number of days since preceding Sunday
- [dayofyear](http://localhost:4444/search/dayofyear/index.md): Get the day number of the year
- [endofday](http://localhost:4444/search/endofday/index.md): The end of day
- [endofmonth](http://localhost:4444/search/endofmonth/index.md): The end of month
- [endofweek](http://localhost:4444/search/endofweek/index.md): The end of week
- [endofyear](http://localhost:4444/search/endofyear/index.md): The end of year
- [format_datetime](http://localhost:4444/search/format-datetime/index.md): Format a datetime
- [format_timespan](http://localhost:4444/search/format-timespan/index.md): Format a timespan
- [getmonth](http://localhost:4444/search/getmonth/index.md): Get the month number from a datetime
- [getyear](http://localhost:4444/search/getyear/index.md): Get the year from a datetime
- [hourofday](http://localhost:4444/search/hourofday/index.md): Get the month number from a datetime
- [make_datetime](http://localhost:4444/search/make-datetime/index.md): Create a datetime
- [make_timespan](http://localhost:4444/search/make-timespan/index.md): Create a timespan
- [monthofyear](http://localhost:4444/search/monthofyear/index.md): Get the month number of a year
- [now](http://localhost:4444/search/now/index.md): Get the current UTC time
- [startofday](http://localhost:4444/search/startofday/index.md): Get the start of the day
- [startofmonth](http://localhost:4444/search/startofmonth/index.md): Get the start of the month
- [startofweek](http://localhost:4444/search/startofweek/index.md): Get the start of the week
- [startofyear](http://localhost:4444/search/startofyear/index.md): Get the start of the year
- [strftime](http://localhost:4444/search/strftime/index.md): Convert a date to a string
- [strptime](http://localhost:4444/search/strptime/index.md): Extract time from a string
- [todatetime](http://localhost:4444/search/todatetime/index.md): Converts the input to a value of type datetime
- [totimespan](http://localhost:4444/search/totimespan/index.md): Converts input into timespan
- [unixtime_microseconds_todatetime](http://localhost:4444/search/unixtime-microseconds-todatetime/index.md): Converts microseconds into datetime
- [unixtime_milliseconds_todatetime](http://localhost:4444/search/unixtime-milliseconds-todatetime/index.md): Converts milliseconds into datetime
- [unixtime_nanoseconds_todatetime](http://localhost:4444/search/unixtime-nanoseconds-todatetime/index.md): Converts nanoseconds into datetime
- [unixtime_seconds_todatetime](http://localhost:4444/search/unixtime-seconds-todatetime/index.md): Converts seconds into datetime
- [week_of_year](http://localhost:4444/search/week-of-year/index.md): Get the week number of a year
- [Dynamic Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/dynamic-functions/index.md): A list of all dynamic functions supported by Cribl Search
- [bag_has_key](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-has-key/index.md): Check whether a property bag contains a given key
- [bag_keys](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-keys/index.md): List all root keys of a property bag
- [bag_merge](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-merge/index.md): Merge multiple property bags, discarding duplicate keys
- [bag_pack](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-pack/index.md): Creates a property bag from an alternating list of keys and values
- [bag_pack_columns](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-pack-columns/index.md): Create a property bag from a list of fields
- [bag_remove_keys](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-remove-keys/index.md): Removes keys and their values from a property bag
- [bag_set_key](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-set-key/index.md): Add or overwrite a key-value pair in a property bag
- [bag_zip](http://localhost:4444/search/bag-zip/index.md): Create a property bag from two dynamic arrays
- [make_bag](http://localhost:4444/search/make-bag/index.md): Create a property bag from multiple input bags
- [make_bag_if](http://localhost:4444/search/make-bag-if/index.md): Create a property bag from those input bags that meet the specified condition
- [zip](http://localhost:4444/search/zip/index.md): Merge multiple dynamic arrays, grouping their elements by index
- [Cryptographic Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/cryptographic-functions/index.md): A list of all cryptographic functions supported by Cribl Search
- [encrypt](http://localhost:4444/search/encrypt/index.md): Encrypt data with a key managed by a Cribl Stream Worker Group
- [decrypt](http://localhost:4444/search/decrypt/index.md): Decrypt data with a key managed by a Cribl Stream Worker Group
- [Hash Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/hash-functions/index.md): A list of all hash functions supported by Cribl Search
- [hash](http://localhost:4444/search/hash/index.md): Hash a value
- [hash_combine](http://localhost:4444/search/hash-combine/index.md): Combine multiple hash values
- [hash_many](http://localhost:4444/search/hash-many/index.md): Get a combined hash value from multiple values
- [hash_md5](http://localhost:4444/search/hash-md5/index.md): Get an MD5 hash value
- [hash_sha1](http://localhost:4444/search/hash-sha1/index.md): Get a SHA1 hash value
- [hash_sha256](http://localhost:4444/search/hash-sha256/index.md): Get a SHA-256 hash value
- [hash_xxhash64](http://localhost:4444/search/hash-xxhash64/index.md): Get a 64-bit hash value
- [INET Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/inet-functions/index.md): A list of all INET functions supported by Cribl Search
- [ipv4_compare](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv4-compare/index.md): Compares two IPv4 strings
- [ipv4_is_in_range](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv4-is-in-range/index.md): Checks if IPv4 string address is in IPv4-prefix notation range
- [ipv4_is_in_any_range](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv4-is-in-any-range/index.md): Checks whether IPv4 string address is in any of the specified IPv4 address ranges
- [ipv4_is_match](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv4-is-match/index.md): Matches two IPv4 strings
- [ipv4_is_private](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv4-is-private/index.md): Checks if IPv4 string address belongs to a set of private network IPs
- [ipv4_netmask_suffix](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv4-netmask-suffix/index.md): Returns the value of the IPv4 netmask suffix from IPv4 string address
- [ipv6_compare](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv6-compare/index.md): Compares two IPv4 or IPv6 strings
- [ipv6_is_match](http://localhost:4444/search/ipv6-is-match/index.md): Matches two IPv6 or IPv4 strings
- [format_bytes](http://localhost:4444/search/format-bytes/index.md): Converts a number into a data-size string
- [format_ipv4](http://localhost:4444/search/format-ipv4/index.md): Parses input with a netmask and returns string representing IPv4 address
- [format_ipv4_mask](http://localhost:4444/search/format-ipv4-mask/index.md): Parses input with a netmask and returns string representing IPv4 address as CIDR notation
- [Mathematical Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/mathematical-functions/index.md): A list of all mathematical functions supported by Cribl Search
- [abs](http://localhost:4444/search/abs/index.md): Calculates the absolute value of the input
- [acos](http://localhost:4444/search/acos/index.md): Returns the angle whose cosine is the specified number
- [asin](http://localhost:4444/search/asin/index.md): Returns the angle whose sine is the specified number
- [atan](http://localhost:4444/search/atan/index.md): Returns the angle whose sine is the specified number
- [atan2](http://localhost:4444/search/atan2/index.md): Returns the angle whose tangent is the specified number
- [beta_cdf](http://localhost:4444/search/beta-cdf/index.md): Returns the standard cumulative beta distribution function
- [beta_inv](http://localhost:4444/search/beta-inv/index.md): Returns the inverse of the beta cumulative probability beta density function
- [beta_pdf](http://localhost:4444/search/beta-pdf/index.md): Returns the probability density beta function
- [ceil](http://localhost:4444/search/ceil/index.md): Rounds up a specified numeric expression's value to its nearest integer
- [ceiling](http://localhost:4444/search/ceiling/index.md): Rounds up a specified numeric expression's value to its nearest integer
- [cos](http://localhost:4444/search/cos/index.md): Returns the cosine function
- [cot](http://localhost:4444/search/cot/index.md): Calculates the trigonometric cotangent of the specified angle, in radians
- [degrees](http://localhost:4444/search/degrees/index.md): Converts angle value in radians into value in degrees
- [exp](http://localhost:4444/search/exp/index.md): The base-e exponential function of x, which is e raised to the power x
- [exp2](http://localhost:4444/search/exp2/index.md): Calculates the base-2 exponential function of x, which is e raised to the power x
- [exp10](http://localhost:4444/search/exp10/index.md): Calculates the base-e exponential function of x, which is e raised to the power x
- [gamma](http://localhost:4444/search/gamma/index.md): Computes gamma function
- [isfinite](http://localhost:4444/search/isfinite/index.md): Returns whether input is a finite value (is neither infinite nor NaN)
- [isinf](http://localhost:4444/search/isinf/index.md): Returns whether input is an infinite (positive or negative) value
- [isnan](http://localhost:4444/search/isnan/index.md): Returns whether input is Not-a-Number (NaN) value
- [log](http://localhost:4444/search/log/index.md): Returns the natural logarithm function
- [log2](http://localhost:4444/search/log2/index.md): Returns the (base-2) logarithm function
- [log10](http://localhost:4444/search/log10/index.md): Returns the common (base-10) logarithm function
- [loggamma](http://localhost:4444/search/loggamma/index.md): Computes loggamma function
- [not](http://localhost:4444/search/not/index.md): Reverses the value of its boolean argument
- [pi](http://localhost:4444/search/pi/index.md): Returns the constant value of Pi
- [pow](http://localhost:4444/search/pow/index.md): Returns a result of raising to power
- [radians](http://localhost:4444/search/radians/index.md): Converts angle value in degrees into value in radians
- [rand](http://localhost:4444/search/rand/index.md): Get a random number
- [range](http://localhost:4444/search/range/index.md): Generates a dynamic array holding a series of equally-spaced values
- [round](http://localhost:4444/search/round/index.md): Returns the rounded source to the specified precision
- [sign](http://localhost:4444/search/sign/index.md): Returns the sign of a numeric expression
- [sin](http://localhost:4444/search/sin/index.md): Returns the sine of a numeric expression
- [sqrt](http://localhost:4444/search/sqrt/index.md): Returns the square root function
- [tan](http://localhost:4444/search/tan/index.md): Returns the tangent function
- [String Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/string-functions/index.md): A list of all string functions supported by Cribl Search
- [base64_decode_toarray](http://localhost:4444/search/base64-decode-toarray/index.md): Decodes a base64 string to an array of single-character strings
- [base64_decode_tostring](http://localhost:4444/search/base64-decode-tostring/index.md): Decodes a base64 string to a UTF-8 string
- [base64_encode_fromarray](http://localhost:4444/search/base64-encode-fromarray/index.md): Encodes a base64 string from a bytes array
- [base64_encode_tostring](http://localhost:4444/search/base64-encode-tostring/index.md): Encodes a string as base64 string
- [countof](http://localhost:4444/search/countof/index.md): Counts occurrences of a substring in a string
- [extract](http://localhost:4444/search/extract/index.md): Get a match for a regular expression from a source string
- [extract_all](http://localhost:4444/search/extract-all/index.md): Get a match for a regular expression from a source string
- [extract_json](http://localhost:4444/search/extract-json/index.md): Get a specified element out of a JSON text using a path expression
- [has_any_index](http://localhost:4444/search/has-any-index/index.md): Get a match for a regular expression from a source string
- [indexof](http://localhost:4444/search/indexof/index.md): Reports the zero-based index of the first occurrence of a specified string within the input string
- [isempty](http://localhost:4444/search/isempty/index.md): Returns true if the argument is an empty string, array, or object, or is null
- [isnotempty](http://localhost:4444/search/isnotempty/index.md): Returns true if the argument isn't an empty string, array, or object, and isn't null
- [isnotnull](http://localhost:4444/search/isnotnull/index.md): Returns true if the argument is not null
- [isnull](http://localhost:4444/search/isnull/index.md): Evaluates its sole argument and returns a boolean value indicating if the argument evaluates to a null value
- [match_regex](http://localhost:4444/search/match_regex/index.md): Match with a regex
- [parse_csv](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-csv/index.md): Splits a given string representing a single record of comma-separated values and returns a string array with these values
- [parse_ipv4](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-ipv4/index.md): Converts IPv4 string to long (signed 64-bit) number representation in big-endian order
- [parse_ipv4_mask](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-ipv4-mask/index.md): Converts the input string of IPv4 and netmask to a signed, 64-bit wide, long number representation in big-endian order
- [parse_ipv6](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-ipv6/index.md): Converts IPv6 or IPv4 string to a canonical IPv6 string representation
- [parse_ipv6_mask](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-ipv6-mask/index.md): Converts IPv6/IPv4 string and netmask to a canonical IPv6 string representation
- [parse_json](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-json/index.md): Interprets a string as a JSON value and returns the value as dynamic
- [parse_url](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-url/index.md): Parses an absolute URL string and returns a dynamic object contains URL parts
- [parse_urlquery](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-urlquery/index.md): Returns a dynamic object contains the Query parameters
- [parse_version](http://localhost:4444/search/parse-version/index.md): Converts the input string representation of a version number to a comparable decimal number
- [replace_regex](http://localhost:4444/search/replace-regex/index.md): Replaces all regex matches with another string
- [reverse](http://localhost:4444/search/reverse/index.md): Reverses the order of the input string
- [split](http://localhost:4444/search/split/index.md): Replaces all regex matches with another string
- [strcat](http://localhost:4444/search/strcat/index.md): Concatenates between 1 and 64 arguments to a single string
- [strcat_delim](http://localhost:4444/search/strcat-delim/index.md): Concatenates between 2 and 64 arguments, with a delimiter
- [strcmp](http://localhost:4444/search/strcmp/index.md): Compares two strings
- [strlen](http://localhost:4444/search/strlen/index.md): Returns the length, in characters, of the input string
- [strrep](http://localhost:4444/search/strrep/index.md): Repeats given string provided amount of times
- [substring](http://localhost:4444/search/substring/index.md): Extracts a substring from a source string starting from some index to the end of the string
- [tolower](http://localhost:4444/search/tolower/index.md): Converts a string to lower case
- [toupper](http://localhost:4444/search/toupper/index.md): Converts a string to upper case
- [translate](http://localhost:4444/search/translate/index.md): Replace a set of characters with another set of characters in a given string
- [trim](http://localhost:4444/search/trim/index.md): Removes all leading and trailing matches of the specified regular expression
- [trim_end](http://localhost:4444/search/trim-end/index.md): Removes trailing match of the specified regular expression
- [trim_start](http://localhost:4444/search/trim-start/index.md): Removes leading match of the specified regular expression
- [url_decode](http://localhost:4444/search/url-decode/index.md): Converts encoded URL into a to regular URL representation
- [url_encode](http://localhost:4444/search/url-encode/index.md): Converts characters of the input URL into a format that can be transmitted over the Internet
- [Statistical Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/statistical-functions/index.md): A list of statistical functions supported by Cribl Search
- [avg](http://localhost:4444/search/avg/index.md): Calculate the average across a group
- [avgif](http://localhost:4444/search/avgif/index.md): Calculate the average across a group of specific events
- [count](http://localhost:4444/search/count/index.md): Count the occurrences of events
- [countif](http://localhost:4444/search/countif/index.md): Count the occurrences of specific events
- [dcount](http://localhost:4444/search/dcount/index.md): Estimates the number of distinct values
- [dcountif](http://localhost:4444/search/dcountif/index.md): Estimates the number of distinct values from specific events
- [max](http://localhost:4444/search/max/index.md): Find the maximum value across a group
- [maxif](http://localhost:4444/search/maxif/index.md): Find the maximum value across a group of specific events
- [min](http://localhost:4444/search/min/index.md): Find the minimum value across a group
- [minif](http://localhost:4444/search/minif/index.md): Find the minimum value across a group of specific events
- [percentile](http://localhost:4444/search/percentile/index.md): Calculate the average across a group of specific events
- [stdev](http://localhost:4444/search/stdev/index.md): Calculate the standard deviation of events
- [stdevif](http://localhost:4444/search/stdevif/index.md): Find the standard deviation across a group of specific events
- [stdevp](http://localhost:4444/search/stdevp/index.md): Calculate the standard deviation of population events
- [sum](http://localhost:4444/search/sum/index.md): Sums the occurrences of events
- [sumif](http://localhost:4444/search/sumif/index.md): Sum specific events
- [variance](http://localhost:4444/search/variance/index.md): Calculate the variance of events
- [varianceif](http://localhost:4444/search/varianceif/index.md): Calculate the variance of specific events
- [variancep](http://localhost:4444/search/variancep/index.md): Calculate the variance of population events
- [Window Functions](http://localhost:4444/search/window-functions/index.md): A list of window functions supported by Cribl Search
- [next](http://localhost:4444/search/next/index.md): Returns the next value of a field
- [prev](http://localhost:4444/search/prev/index.md): Returns the previous value of a field
- [row_cumsum](http://localhost:4444/search/row_cumsum/index.md): Calculates the cumulative sum
- [row_number](http://localhost:4444/search/row_number/index.md): Returns the current row's index
- [row_rank_dense](http://localhost:4444/search/row_rank_dense/index.md): Assigns a dense rank
- [row_rank_min](http://localhost:4444/search/row_rank_min/index.md): Assigns a minimal rank
- [row_window_session](http://localhost:4444/search/row_window_session/index.md): Identify session starts
- [Virtual Tables](http://localhost:4444/search/virtual-tables/index.md): Learn about virtual tables
- [$vt_datasets](http://localhost:4444/search/vt_datasets/index.md): List available Datasets
- [$vt_dataset_providers](http://localhost:4444/search/vt_dataset_providers/index.md): List available Dataset Providers
- [$vt_dummy](http://localhost:4444/search/vt_dummy/index.md): Generate dummy data
- [$vt_jobs](http://localhost:4444/search/vt_jobs/index.md): List previously executed searches
- [$vt_list](http://localhost:4444/search/vt_list/index.md): List available virtual tables
- [$vt_lookups](http://localhost:4444/search/vt_lookups/index.md): List available lookups, or get the contents of a specific lookup
- [$vt_results](http://localhost:4444/search/vt_results/index.md): Access the results of previous searches
- [Types](http://localhost:4444/search/types/index.md): Supported types of data in Cribl Search
- [bool](http://localhost:4444/search/bool/index.md): The bool data type
- [datetime](http://localhost:4444/search/datetime/index.md): The datetime data type
- [decimal](http://localhost:4444/search/decimal/index.md): The decimal data type
- [double](http://localhost:4444/search/double/index.md): The double data type
- [dynamic](http://localhost:4444/search/dynamic/index.md): The dynamic data type
- [int](http://localhost:4444/search/int/index.md): The int data type
- [long](http://localhost:4444/search/long/index.md): The long data type
- [null](http://localhost:4444/search/null/index.md): The null value
- [real](http://localhost:4444/search/real/index.md): The real data type
- [string](http://localhost:4444/search/string/index.md): The string data type
- [timespan](http://localhost:4444/search/timespan/index.md): The timespan data type
- [Regex Matching](http://localhost:4444/search/regex-matching/index.md): Regular expressions examples, supported flags, and syntax details
- [API Reference](http://localhost:4444/cribl-as-code/)

## Cribl Lake

- [About Cribl Lake](http://localhost:4444/lake/about/index.md): Cribl Lake is a storage solution aimed at long-term, full-fidelity data storage for IT and security data
- [Lake Datasets](http://localhost:4444/lake/datasets/index.md): Organize different types of data stored in Cribl Lake
- [Manage Lake Datasets](http://localhost:4444/lake/managing-datasets/index.md): Create, edit, partition, datatype, and delete Lake Datasets
- [Search Cribl Lake](http://localhost:4444/lake/search-cribl-lake/index.md): Search your Cribl Lake Datasets with Cribl Search
- [Lakehouses in Cribl Lake](http://localhost:4444/lake/lakehouse/index.md): Search Cribl Lake faster with a Lakehouse
- [Streamline Logs Storage and Analysis with a Lakehouse](http://localhost:4444/lake/lakehouse-logs/index.md): Use Lakehouse with Cribl Search to analyze high-volume, recent security data in application logs
- [Cribl Lake Permissions](http://localhost:4444/lake/lake-permissions/index.md): Manage access to Cribl Lake Datasets by assigning product-level Permissions
- [Cribl Lake Collector](http://localhost:4444/lake/collectors-cribl-lake/index.md): Replay data from Cribl Lake
- [Cribl Lake Destination](http://localhost:4444/lake/destinations-cribl-lake/index.md): Send your data from Cribl Stream to Cribl Lake
- [Cribl Lake Direct Access](http://localhost:4444/lake/direct-access/index.md): Archive data directly to Cribl Lake
- [Direct Access (HTTP)](http://localhost:4444/lake/direct-access-http/index.md): Archive data directly to Cribl Lake over HTTP
- [Splunk Cloud Self Storage (DDSS) Direct Access](http://localhost:4444/lake/splunk-cloud/index.md): Archive Splunk Cloud Self Storage (DDSS) data directly to Cribl Lake, bypassing Cribl Stream processing
- [Storage Locations (Bring Your Own Storage)](http://localhost:4444/lake/byos/index.md): Create Datasets on storage that you directly own, combining compliance with Cribl Lake streamlined provisioning, retention policies, and access control
- [Integrating Cribl Lake with Cribl Edge](http://localhost:4444/lake/integrating-lake-with-edge/index.md): Archive Cribl Edge data to Cribl Lake, via Cribl Stream
- [Troubleshooting](http://localhost:4444/lake/known-issues/index.md): Find bugs and limitations affecting Cribl Lake, with fix versions or workarounds

- [Cribl Core API Reference](http://localhost:4444/cribl-as-code/api-reference/control-plane/cribl-core/index.md): Control Plane API for Cribl Core
- [Cribl Stream API Reference](http://localhost:4444/cribl-as-code/api-reference/control-plane/cribl-stream/index.md): Control Plane API for Cribl Stream
- [Cribl Edge API Reference](http://localhost:4444/cribl-as-code/api-reference/control-plane/cribl-edge/index.md): Control Plane API for Cribl Edge
- [Cribl Search API Reference](http://localhost:4444/cribl-as-code/api-reference/control-plane/cribl-search/index.md): Control Plane API for Cribl Search
- [Cribl Lake API Reference](http://localhost:4444/cribl-as-code/api-reference/control-plane/cribl-lake/index.md): Control Plane API for Cribl Lake
- [Management Plane API Reference](http://localhost:4444/cribl-as-code/api-reference/management-plane/workspaces/index.md): Management Plane API for Workspaces
