- [Product Suite Interoperation](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/ref-arch-products/index.md): Product Interoperation
- [Interoperation Protocols](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/ref-arch-protocols/index.md): Interoperation Protocols
- [Event Processing](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-event-processing/index.md): Event processing architectural considerations
- [Operational Monitoring](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-monitoring/index.md): Monitoring operational health, data flows, and change events
- [Overview of Deployment Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-deploy-intro/index.md): Deployment Architecture and Implementation
- [Deployment Terminology](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-deployment-terminology/index.md): Deployment Terminology
- [Choosing an Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-deployment-framework/index.md): Choose your architecture
- [Worker Group and Fleet Placement](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/worker-group-placement/index.md): Guide for deciding the placement of Worker Groups and Fleets
- [High Availability Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-deploy-ha/index.md): High Availability Architecture
- [Cribl Outpost Consideration](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-outpost/index.md): Introducing Cribl Outpost for HA deployment considerations
- [Cribl.Cloud Architecture Overview](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-cloud-overview/index.md): Architectural Concepts Overview
- [Cribl.Cloud Security Practices](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-cloud-security-practices/index.md): Cribl.Cloud Security Practices
- [Cribl.Cloud Architecture Planning](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-cloud-arch-planning/index.md): Cribl.Cloud Architecture Planning
- [Required Ports in Cribl.Cloud](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-cloud-ports/index.md): Ports in Cribl.Cloud Reference Architecture
- [Cribl.Cloud/Customer Responsibilities](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-cloud-security-responsibility/index.md): Cribl.Cloud Customer Responsibility Matrix
- [Cribl.Cloud Identity and Authorization Model](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-deploy-id-auth/index.md): Cribl.Cloud Identity and Authorization Model
- [On-Prem Architecture Planning](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-onprem-planning/index.md): On-Prem Architecture Planning
- [Cribl Edge-Specific Considerations](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-edge-considerations/index.md): Cribl Edge-Specific Considerations
- [Hybrid Deployment Architecture Planning](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-hybrid-planning/index.md): Hybrid Deployment Architecture Planning
- [Securing On-Prem and Hybrid Deployments](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-onprem-security/index.md): Securing On-Prem and Hybrid Deployments
- [Sources and Destinations](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-sources-destinations/index.md): Sources and Destinations Overview
- [Source Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-sources/index.md): Source types and architectural considerations
- [Destination Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-destinations/index.md): Destination types and architectural considerations
- [Data Resilience and Workload Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-resilience-workload/index.md): Data resilience and workload considerations
- [Configuration Management](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-configuration-management/index.md): Guide for developing an initial configuration management and content development plan
- [Standard Configuration Management](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-config-manage-standard/index.md): Overview of the Cribl control plane configuration management approach
- [Advanced Configuration Management](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-config-manage-advanced/index.md): Overview of the Pack-based configuration management approach for Cribl
- [Scale Configuration Management with the API](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-api-automation-and-scaling/index.md): Automating and scaling configuration management using the Cribl API
- [Plan a Cribl Upgrade Strategy](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-upgrade-cribl/index.md): Automating and scaling configuration management using the Cribl API
- [Specialized Reference Architectures](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/arch-ref-specialized/index.md): An Overview page of Specialized Reference Architectures
- [Cribl Reference Architecture, Full-Suite](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/reference-arch-full-suite/index.md): Reference architecture showing a Cribl.Cloud Leader's options to combine and interconnect all Cribl products
- [Syslog to Cribl Stream Reference Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/reference-arch-syslog/index.md): Reference architecture demonstrating syslog data ingest and processing in Cribl Stream
- [Unified Ingest & Replay Data](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/deploy-reference-data/index.md): Cribl Stream reference architecture for ingesting and replaying diverse data types from multiple senders
- [Distributed Agents Reference Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/deploy-reference-many-agents/index.md): Reference Cribl Stream architecture to ingest data from a large quantity of agents
- [Multi-Destination Enterprise Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/deploy-reference-destinations/index.md): Reference Cribl Stream architecture to minimize data egress costs to diverse destinations
- [Hybrid Cloud Data Architecture](http://localhost:4444/reference-architectures/deploy-hybrid-data/index.md): Reference Cribl Stream architecture to minimize data egress costs with Cribl.Cloud hybrid Workers

## Use Cases

- [Use Cribl Products to Reduce Data Storage Costs](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-reduce-cost/index.md): Strategies to help manage and potentially reduce SIEM costs
- [Simplify Data Collection, Processing, and Routing with Cribl Stream](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-simplify/index.md): How to use Cribl Stream to simplify data collection, processing, and routing in your organization
- [Search and Analyze Data Directly at Its Source Using Cribl Search](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-search/index.md): How to use Cribl Search to search, explore, and analyze machine data in place without first moving it to specialized storage
- [Use Cribl Edge to Collect Logs and Metrics on a Host Device](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-edge/index.md): How to use Cribl Edge to collect data in real time from your Linux and Windows machines, apps, and microservices
- [Migrate from an On-Prem Deployment to Cribl.Cloud](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-migrate-cloud/index.md): How to migrate to Cribl.Cloud to simplify management, reduce overhead, and provide scalability
- [Quickly implement Cribl Lake as Your Out-of-the-Box Data Lake Solution](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-cribl-lake/index.md): Implement a data lake solution that is easy to set up, configure, and manage
- [Use Cribl Products to Change the Shape, Size, or Quality of Data](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-transform/index.md): How to use Cribl to transform data by processing it through a Pipeline
- [Use Cribl Search to Explore Data in an Amazon S3 Bucket](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-s3/index.md): How to connect Cribl Search to AWS and start querying your Amazon S3 buckets
- [Route Data to Multiple Destinations Using Cribl Stream](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-stream/index.md): How to use Cribl Stream to route data to multiple downstream analytics and storage services
- [Use Cribl to Enrich Data Events with Context](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-enrich/index.md): How to use Cribl to leverage Pipelines and Functions to enrich data events
- [Use Cribl Products to Remove or Disguise Sensitive Data](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-pii/index.md): How to use Cribl to remove or disguise sensitive data (PII) to comply with regulations
- [Use Cribl Products to Reduce the Size of Data for Cost Savings and Performance](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-reduce-size/index.md): Use Cribl to reduce the size of your data and optimize performance
- [Use Cribl to Replay Data from Low-Cost Storage](http://localhost:4444/use-cases/usecase-replay/index.md): How to use Cribl to access and analyze data stored in cost-effective locations
